summary.long: Exodus is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: And these [are] the names of the sons of Israel who are coming into Egypt with Jacob; a man and his household have they come;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the persons coming out of the thigh of Jacob are seventy persons; as to Joseph, he was in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph dieth, and all his brethren, and all that generation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel have been fruitful, and they teem, and multiply, and are very very mighty, and the land is filled with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there riseth a new king over Egypt, who hath not known Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith unto his people, `Lo, the people of the sons of Israel [is] more numerous and mighty than we;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: give help! let us act wisely concerning it, lest it multiply, and it hath come to pass, when war happeneth, that it hath been joined, even it, unto those hating us, and hath fought against us, and hath gone out up of the land.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set over it princes of tribute, so as to afflict it with their burdens, and it buildeth store-cities for Pharaoh, Pithom and Raamses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and as they afflict it, so it multiplieth, and so it breaketh forth, and they are vexed because of the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Egyptians cause the sons of Israel to serve with rigour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make their lives bitter in hard service, in clay, and in brick, and in every [kind] of service in the field; all their service in which they have served [is] with rigour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Egypt speaketh to the midwives, the Hebrewesses, (of whom the name of the one [is] Shiphrah, and the name of the second Puah),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saith, `When ye cause the Hebrew women to bear, and have looked on the children; if it [is] a son -- then ye have put him to death; and if it [is] a daughter -- then she hath lived.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the midwives fear God, and have not done as the king of Egypt hath spoken unto them, and keep the lads alive;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the king of Egypt calleth for the midwives, and saith to them, `Wherefore have ye done this thing, and keep the lads alive?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the midwives say unto Pharaoh, `Because the Hebrew women [are] not as the Egyptian women, for they [are] lively; before the midwife cometh in unto them -- they have borne!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God doth good to the midwives, and the people multiply, and are very mighty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it cometh to pass, because the midwives have feared God, that He maketh for them households;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh layeth a charge on all his people, saying, `Every son who is born -- into the River ye do cast him, and every daughter ye do keep alive.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there goeth a man of the house of Levi, and he taketh the daughter of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the woman conceiveth, and beareth a son, and she seeth him that he [is] fair, and she hideth him three months,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she hath not been able any more to hide him, and she taketh for him an ark of rushes, and daubeth it with bitumen and with pitch, and putteth the lad in it, and putteth [it] in the weeds by the edge of the River;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his sister stationeth herself afar off, to know what is done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a daughter of Pharaoh cometh down to bathe at the River, and her damsels are walking by the side of the River, and she seeth the ark in the midst of the weeds, and sendeth her handmaid, and she taketh it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and openeth, and seeth him -- the lad, and lo, a child weeping! and she hath pity on him, and saith, `This is [one] of the Hebrews' children.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sister saith unto the daughter of Pharaoh, `Do I go? when I have called for thee a suckling woman of the Hebrews, then she doth suckle the lad for thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the daughter of Pharaoh saith to her, `Go;' and the virgin goeth, and calleth the mother of the lad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the daughter of Pharaoh saith to her, `Take this lad away, and suckle him for me, and I -- I give thy hire;' and the woman taketh the lad, and suckleth him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lad groweth, and she bringeth him in to the daughter of Pharaoh, and he is to her for a son, and she calleth his name Moses, and saith, `Because -- from the water I have drawn him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, in those days, that Moses is grown, and he goeth out unto his brethren, and looketh on their burdens, and seeth a man, an Egyptian, smiting a man, a Hebrew, [one] of his brethren,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he turneth hither and thither, and seeth that there is no man, and smiteth the Egyptian, and hideth him in the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he goeth out on the second day, and lo, two men, Hebrews, striving! and he saith to the wrong-doer, `Why dost thou smite thy neighbour?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith, `Who set thee for a head and a judge over us? to slay me art thou saying [it], as thou hast slain the Egyptian?' and Moses feareth, and saith, `Surely the thing hath been known.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh heareth of this thing, and seeketh to slay Moses, and Moses fleeth from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelleth in the land of Midian, and dwelleth by the well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to a priest of Midian [are] seven daughters, and they come and draw, and fill the troughs, to water the flock of their father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the shepherds come and drive them away, and Moses ariseth, and saveth them, and watereth their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they come in to Reuel their father, and he saith, `Wherefore have ye hastened to come in to-day?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they say, `A man, an Egyptian, hath delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also hath diligently drawn for us, and watereth the flock;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith unto his daughters, `And where [is] he? why [is] this? -- ye left the man! call for him, and he doth eat bread.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses is willing to dwell with the man, and he giveth Zipporah his daughter to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she beareth a son, and he calleth his name Gershom, for he said, `A sojourner I have been in a strange land.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass during these many days, that the king of Egypt dieth, and the sons of Israel sigh because of the service, and cry, and their cry goeth up unto God, because of the service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God heareth their groaning, and God remembereth His covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God seeth the sons of Israel, and God knoweth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses hath been feeding the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, priest of Midian, and he leadeth the flock behind the wilderness, and cometh in unto the mount of God, to Horeb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there appeareth unto him a messenger of Jehovah in a flame of fire, out of the midst of the bush, and he seeth, and lo, the bush is burning with fire, and the bush is not consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith, `Let me turn aside, I pray thee, and I see this great appearance; wherefore is the bush not burned?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah seeth that he hath turned aside to see, and God calleth unto him out of the midst of the bush, and saith, `Moses, Moses;' and he saith, `Here [am] I.'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And He saith, `Come not near hither: cast thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place on which thou art standing is holy ground.'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: He saith also, `I [am] the God of thy father, God of Abraham, God of Isaac, and God of Jacob;' and Moses hideth his face, for he is afraid to look towards God.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Jehovah saith, `I have certainly seen the affliction of My people who [are] in Egypt, and their cry I have heard, because of its exactors, for I have known its pains;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and I go down to deliver it out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to cause it to go up out of the land, unto a land good and broad, unto a land flowing with milk and honey -- unto the place of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: `And now, lo, the cry of the sons of Israel hath come in unto Me, and I have also seen the oppression with which the Egyptians are oppressing them,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and now, come, and I send thee unto Pharaoh, and bring thou out My people, the sons of Israel, out of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses saith unto God, `Who [am] I, that I go unto Pharaoh, and that I bring out the sons of Israel from Egypt?'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and He saith, `Because I am with thee, and this [is] to thee the sign that I have sent thee: in thy bringing out the people from Egypt -- ye do serve God on this mount.'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses saith unto God, `Lo, I am coming unto the sons of Israel, and have said to them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you, and they have said to me, What [is] His name? what do I say unto them?'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God saith unto Moses, `I Am That Which I Am;' He saith also, `Thus dost thou say to the sons of Israel, I Am hath sent me unto you.'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God saith again unto Moses, `Thus dost thou say unto the sons of Israel, Jehovah, God of your fathers, God of Abraham, God of Isaac, and God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you; this [is] My name -- to the age, and this My memorial, to generation -- generation.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: `Go, and thou hast gathered the elders of Israel, and hast said unto them: Jehovah, God of your fathers, hath appeareth unto me, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, I have certainly inspected you, and that which is done to you in Egypt;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and I say, I bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt, unto the land of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, unto a land flowing [with] milk and honey.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: `And they have hearkened to thy voice, and thou hast entered, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye have said unto him, Jehovah, God of the Hebrews, hath met with us; and now, let us go, we pray thee, a journey of three days into the wilderness, and we sacrifice to Jehovah our God.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: `And I -- I have known that the king of Egypt doth not permit you to go, unless by a strong hand,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and I have put forth My hand, and have smitten Egypt with all My wonders, which I do in its midst -- and afterwards he doth send you away.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: `And I have given the grace of this people in the eyes of the Egyptians, and it hath come to pass, when ye go, ye go not empty;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and [every] woman hath asked from her neighbour, and from her who is sojourning in her house, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and garments, and ye have put [them] on your sons and on your daughters, and have spoiled the Egyptians.'
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And Moses answereth and saith, `And, if they do not give credence to me, nor hearken to my voice, and say, Jehovah hath not appeared unto thee?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto him, `What [is] this in thy hand?' and he saith, `A rod;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He saith, `Cast it to the earth;' and he casteth it to the earth, and it becometh a serpent -- and Moses fleeth from its presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Put forth thy hand, and lay hold on the tail of it;' and he putteth forth his hand, and layeth hold on it, and it becometh a rod in his hand --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `-- so that they believe that Jehovah, God of their fathers, hath appeared unto thee, God of Abraham, God of Isaac, and God of Jacob.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith to him again, `Put in, I pray thee, thy hand into thy bosom;' and he putteth in his hand into his bosom, and he bringeth it out, and lo, his hand [is] leprous as snow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He saith, `Put back thy hand unto thy bosom;' and he putteth back his hand unto his bosom, and he bringeth it out from his bosom, and lo, it hath turned back as his flesh --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `-- and it hath come to pass, if they do not give credence to thee, and hearken not to the voice of the first sign, that they have given credence to the voice of the latter sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath come to pass, if they do not give credence even to these two signs, nor hearken to thy voice, that thou hast taken of the waters of the River, and hast poured on the dry land, and the waters which thou takest from the River have been, yea, they have become -- blood on the dry land.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Jehovah, `O, my Lord, I [am] not a man of words, either yesterday, or before, or since Thy speaking unto Thy servant, for I [am] slow of mouth, and slow of tongue.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto him, `Who appointed a mouth for man? or who appointeth the dumb, or deaf, or open, or blind? is it not I, Jehovah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, go, and I -- I am with thy mouth, and have directed thee that which thou speakest;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith, `O, my Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand Thou dost send.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the anger of Jehovah burneth against Moses, and He saith, `Is not Aaron the Levite thy brother? I have known that he speaketh well, and also, lo, he is coming out to meet thee; when he hath seen thee, then he hath rejoiced in his heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast spoken unto him, and hast set the words in his mouth, and I -- I am with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and have directed you that which ye do;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he, he hath spoken for thee unto the people, and it hath come to pass, he -- he is to thee for a mouth, and thou -- thou art to him for God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and this rod thou dost take in thy hand, with which thou doest the signs.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth and turneth back unto Jethro his father-in-law, and saith to him, `Let me go, I pray thee, and I turn back unto my brethren who [are] in Egypt, and I see whether they are yet alive.' And Jethro saith to Moses, `Go in peace.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses in Midian, `Go, turn back to Egypt, for all the men have died who seek thy life;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses taketh his wife, and his sons, and causeth them to ride on the ass, and turneth back to the land of Egypt, and Moses taketh the rod of God in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `In thy going to turn back to Egypt, see -- all the wonders which I have put in thy hand -- that thou hast done them before Pharaoh, and I -- I strengthen his heart, and he doth not send the people away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast said unto Pharaoh, Thus said Jehovah, My son, My first-born [is] Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say unto thee, Send away My son, and he doth serve Me; and -- thou dost refuse to send him away -- lo, I am slaying thy son, thy first-born.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass in the way, in a lodging place, that Jehovah meeteth him, and seeketh to put him to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zipporah taketh a flint, and cutteth off the foreskin of her son, and causeth [it] to touch his feet, and saith, `Surely a bridegroom of blood [art] thou to me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He desisteth from him: then she said, `A bridegroom of blood,' in reference to the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Aaron, `Go to meet Moses into the wilderness;' and he goeth, and meeteth him in the mount of God, and kisseth him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses declareth to Aaron all the words of Jehovah with which He hath sent him, and all the signs with which He hath charged him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth -- Aaron also -- and they gather all the elders of the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron speaketh all the words which Jehovah hath spoken unto Moses, and doth the signs before the eyes of the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the people believe when they hear that Jehovah hath looked after the sons of Israel, and that He hath seen their affliction; and they bow and do obeisance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterwards have Moses and Aaron entered, and they say unto Pharaoh, `Thus said Jehovah, God of Israel, Send My people away, and they keep a feast to Me in the wilderness;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh saith, `Who [is] Jehovah, that I hearken to His voice, to send Israel away? I have not known Jehovah, and Israel also I do not send away.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they say, `The God of the Hebrews hath met with us, let us go, we pray thee, a journey of three days into the wilderness, and we sacrifice to Jehovah our God, lest He meet us with pestilence or with sword.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king of Egypt saith unto them, `Why, Moses and Aaron, do ye free the people from its works? go to your burdens.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh also saith, `Lo, numerous now [is] the people of the land, and ye have caused them to cease from their burdens!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh commandeth, on that day, the exactors among the people and its authorities, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not add to give straw to the people for the making of the bricks, as heretofore -- they go and have gathered straw for themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the proper quantity of the bricks which they are making heretofore ye do put on them, ye do not diminish from it, for they are remiss, therefore they are crying, saying, Let us go, let us sacrifice to our God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let the service be heavy on the men, and let them work at it, and not be dazzled by lying words.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the exactors of the people, and its authorities, go out, and speak unto the people, saying, `Thus said Pharaoh, I do not give you straw,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye -- go ye, take for yourselves straw where ye find [it], for there is nothing of your service diminished.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people is scattered over all the land of Egypt, to gather stubble for straw,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the exactors are making haste, saying, `Complete your works, the matter of a day in its day, as when there is straw.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the authorities of the sons of Israel, whom the exactors of Pharaoh have placed over them, are beaten, saying, `Wherefore have ye not completed your portion in making brick as heretofore, both yesterday and to-day?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the authorities of the sons of Israel come in and cry unto Pharaoh, saying, `Why dost thou thus to thy servants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Straw is not given to thy servants, and they are saying to us, Make bricks, and lo, thy servants are smitten -- and thy people hath sinned.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saith, `Remiss -- ye are remiss, therefore ye are saying, Let us go, let us sacrifice to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, go, serve; and straw is not given to you, and the measure of bricks ye do give.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the authorities of the sons of Israel see them in affliction, saying, `Ye do not diminish from your bricks; the matter of a day in its day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they meet Moses and Aaron standing to meet them, in their coming out from Pharaoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say unto them, `Jehovah look upon you, and judge, because ye have caused our fragrance to stink in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of his servants -- to give a sword into their hand to slay us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses turneth back unto Jehovah, and saith, `Lord, why hast Thou done evil to this people? why [is] this? -- Thou hast sent me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and since I have come unto Pharaoh, to speak in Thy name, he hath done evil to this people, and Thou hast not at all delivered Thy people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Now dost thou see that which I do to Pharaoh, for with a strong hand he doth send them away, yea, with a strong hand he doth cast them out of his land.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God speaketh unto Moses, and saith unto him, `I [am] Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I appear unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, as God Almighty; as to My name Jehovah, I have not been known to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also I have established My covenant with them, to give to them the land of Canaan, the land of their sojournings, wherein they have sojourned;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also I have heard the groaning of the sons of Israel, whom the Egyptians are causing to serve, and I remember My covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Therefore say to the sons of Israel, I [am] Jehovah, and I have brought you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and have delivered you from their service, and have redeemed you by a stretched-out arm, and by great judgments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have taken you to Me for a people, and I have been to you for God, and ye have known that I [am] Jehovah your God, who is bringing you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have brought you in unto the land which I have lifted up My hand to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, and have given it to you -- a possession; I [am] Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh so unto the sons of Israel, and they hearkened not unto Moses, for anguish of spirit, and for harsh service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Go in, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he doth send the sons of Israel out of his land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses speaketh before Jehovah, saying, `Lo, the sons of Israel have not hearkened unto me, and how doth Pharaoh hear me, and I of uncircumcised lips?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, and unto Aaron, and chargeth them for the sons of Israel, and for Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These [are] heads of the house of their fathers: Sons of Reuben first-born of Israel [are] Hanoch, and Phallu, Hezron, and Carmi: these [are] families of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Simeon [are] Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul, son of the Canaanitess: these [are] families of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these [are] the names of the sons of Levi, as to their births: Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari: and the years of the life of Levi [are] a hundred and thirty and seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershon [are] Libni, and Shimi, as to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Kohath [are] Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel: and the years of the life of Kohath [are] a hundred and thirty and three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Merari [are] Mahli and Mushi: these [are] families of Levi, as to their births.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amram taketh Jochebed his aunt to himself for a wife, and she beareth to him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram [are] a hundred and thirty and seven years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Izhar [are] Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Uzziel [are] Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron taketh Elisheba daughter of Amminadab, sister of Naashon, to himself for a wife, and she beareth to him Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sons of Korah [are] Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph: these [are] families of the Korhite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar, Aaron's son, hath taken to him [one] of the daughters of Putiel for a wife to himself, and she beareth to him Phinehas: these [are] heads of the fathers of the Levites, as to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This [is] Aaron -- and Moses -- to whom Jehovah said, `Bring ye out the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt, by their hosts;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these are they who are speaking unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the sons of Israel from Egypt, this [is] Moses -- and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass in the day of Jehovah's speaking unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying, `I [am] Jehovah, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I am speaking unto thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith before Jehovah, `Lo, I [am] of uncircumcised lips, and how doth Pharaoh hearken unto me?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `See, I have given thee a god to Pharaoh, and Aaron thy brother is thy prophet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou -- thou dost speak all that I command thee, and Aaron thy brother doth speak unto Pharaoh, and he hath sent the sons of Israel out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I harden the heart of Pharaoh, and have multiplied My signs and My wonders in the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh doth not hearken, and I have put My hand on Egypt, and have brought out My hosts, My people, the sons of Israel, from the land of Egypt by great judgments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Egyptians have known that I [am] Jehovah, in My stretching out My hand against Egypt; and I have brought out the sons of Israel from their midst.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses doth -- Aaron also -- as Jehovah commanded them; so have they done;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses [is] a son of eighty years, and Aaron [is] a son of eighty and three years, in their speaking unto Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When Pharaoh speaketh unto you, saying, Give for yourselves a wonder; then thou hast said unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast before Pharaoh -- it becometh a monster.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth in -- Aaron also -- unto Pharaoh, and they do so as Jehovah hath commanded; and Aaron casteth his rod before Pharaoh, and before his servants, and it becometh a monster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh also calleth for wise men, and for sorcerers; and the scribes of Egypt, they also, with their flashings, do so,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they cast down each his rod, and they become monsters, and the rod of Aaron swalloweth their rods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the heart of Pharaoh is strong, and he hath not hearkened unto them, as Jehovah hath spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `The heart of Pharaoh hath been hard, he hath refused to send the people away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: go unto Pharaoh in the morning, lo, he is going out to the water, and thou hast stood to meet him by the edge of the River, and the rod which was turned to a serpent thou dost take in thy hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast said unto him: Jehovah, God of the Hebrews, hath sent me unto thee, saying, Send My people away, and they serve Me in the wilderness; and lo, thou hast not hearkened hitherto.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thus said Jehovah: By this thou knowest that I [am] Jehovah; lo, I am smiting with the rod which [is] in my hand, on the waters which [are] in the River, and they have been turned to blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fish that [are] in the River die, and the River hath stank, and the Egyptians have been wearied of drinking waters from the River.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thy hand against the waters of Egypt, against their streams, against their rivers, and against their ponds, and against all their collections of waters; and they are blood -- and there hath been blood in all the land of Egypt, both in [vessels of] wood, and in [those of] stone.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron do so, as Jehovah hath commanded, and he lifteth up [his hand] with the rod, and smiteth the waters which [are] in the River, before the eyes of Pharaoh, and before the eyes of his servants, and all the waters which [are] in the River are turned to blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fish which [is] in the River hath died, and the River stinketh, and the Egyptians have not been able to drink water from the River; and the blood is in all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes of Egypt do so with their flashings, and the heart of Pharaoh is strong, and he hath not hearkened unto them, as Jehovah hath spoken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh turneth and goeth in unto his house, and hath not set his heart even to this;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the Egyptians seek water round about the river to drink, for they have not been able to drink of the waters of the River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seven days are completed after Jehovah's smiting the River,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Go in unto Pharaoh: and thou hast said unto him, Thus said Jehovah, Send My people away, and they serve Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if thou art refusing to send away, lo, I am smiting all thy border with frogs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the River hath teemed [with] frogs, and they have gone up and gone into thy house, and into the inner-chamber of thy bed, and on thy couch, and into the house of thy servants, and among thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneading-troughs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, on thee, and on thy people, and on all thy servants do the frogs go up.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy hand, with thy rod, against the streams, against the rivers, and against the ponds, and cause the frogs to come up against the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron stretcheth out his hand against the waters of Egypt, and the frog cometh up, and covereth the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the scribes do so with their flashings, and cause the frogs to come up against the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh calleth for Moses and for Aaron, and saith, `Make supplication unto Jehovah, that he turn aside the frogs from me, and from my people, and I send the people away, and they sacrifice to Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith to Pharaoh, `Beautify thyself over me; when do I make supplication for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, to cut off the frogs from thee and from thy houses -- only in the River they do remain?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith, `To-morrow.' And he saith, According to thy word [it is], so that thou knowest that there is none like Jehovah our God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the frogs have turned aside from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; only in the River they do remain.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses -- Aaron also -- goeth out from Pharaoh, and Moses crieth unto Jehovah, concerning the matter of the frogs which He hath set on Pharaoh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah doth according to the word of Moses, and the frogs die out of the houses, out of the courts, and out of the fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they heap them up together, and the land stinketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh seeth that there hath been a respite, and he hath hardened his heart, and hath not hearkened unto them, as Jehovah hath spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the land, and it hath become gnats in all the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they do so, and Aaron stretcheth out his hand with his rod, and smiteth the dust of the land, and the gnats are on man and on beast; all the dust of the land hath been gnats in all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes do so with their flashings, to bring out the gnats, and they have not been able, and the gnats are on man and on beast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the scribes say unto Pharaoh, `It [is] the finger of God;' and the heart of Pharaoh is strong, and he hath not hearkened unto them, as Jehovah hath spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Rise early in the morning, and station thyself before Pharaoh, lo, he is going out to the waters, and thou hast said unto him, Thus said Jehovah, Send My people away, and they serve Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, if thou art not sending My people away, lo, I am sending against thee, and against thy servants, and against thy people, and against thy houses, the beetle, and the houses of the Egyptians have been full of the beetle, and also the ground on which they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have separated in that day the land of Goshen, in which My people are staying, that the beetle is not there, so that thou knowest that I [am] Jehovah in the midst of the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have put a division between My people and thy people: to-morrow is this sign.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah doth so, and the grievous beetle entereth the house of Pharaoh, and the house of his servants, and in all the land of Egypt the land is corrupted from the presence of the beetle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh calleth unto Moses and to Aaron, and saith, `Go, sacrifice to your God in the land;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith, `Not right to do so, for the abomination of the Egyptians we do sacrifice to Jehovah our God; lo, we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes -- and they do not stone us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A journey of three days we go into the wilderness, and have sacrificed to Jehovah our God, as He saith unto us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh saith, `I send you away, and ye have sacrificed to Jehovah your God in the wilderness, only go not very far off; make ye supplication for me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith, `Lo, I am going out from thee, and have made supplication unto Jehovah, and the beetle hath turned aside from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people -- to-morrow, only let not Pharaoh add to deceive -- in not sending the people away to sacrifice to Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth out from Pharaoh, and maketh supplication unto Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah doth according to the word of Moses, and turneth aside the beetle from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people -- there hath not been left one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh hardeneth his heart also at this time, and hath not sent the people away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Go in unto Pharaoh, and thou hast spoken unto him, Thus said Jehovah, God of the Hebrews, Send My people away, and they serve me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, if thou art refusing to send away, and art still keeping hold upon them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lo, the hand of Jehovah is on thy cattle which [are] in the field, on horses, on asses, on camels, on herd, and on flock -- a pestilence very grievous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah hath separated between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt, and there doth not die a thing of all the sons of Israel's;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah setteth an appointed time, saying, To-morrow doth Jehovah do this thing in the land.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah doth this thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt die, and of the cattle of the sons of Israel not one hath died;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh sendeth, and lo, not even one of the cattle of Israel hath died, and the heart of Pharaoh is hard, and he hath not sent the people away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses and unto Aaron, `Take to you the fulness of your hands [of] soot of a furnace, and Moses hath sprinkled it towards the heavens, before the eyes of Pharaoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and it hath become on man and on cattle a boil breaking forth [with] blains, in all the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they take the soot of the furnace, and stand before Pharaoh, and Moses sprinkleth it towards the heavens, and it is a boil [with] blains, breaking forth, on man and on beast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the scribes have not been able to stand before Moses, because of the boil, for the boil hath been on the scribes, and on all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah strengtheneth the heart of Pharaoh, and he hath not hearkened unto them, as Jehovah hath spoken unto Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Rise early in the morning, and station thyself before Pharaoh, and thou hast said unto him, Thus said Jehovah, God of the Hebrews, Send My people away, and they serve Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, at this time I am sending all My plagues unto thy heart, and on thy servants, and on thy people, so that thou knowest that there is none like Me in all the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for now I have put forth My hand, and I smite thee, and thy people, with pestilence, and thou art hidden from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And yet for this I have caused thee to stand, so as to show thee My power, and for the sake of declaring My Name in all the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: still thou art exalting thyself against My people -- so as not to send them away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lo, I am raining about [this] time to-morrow hail very grievous, such as hath not been in Egypt, even from the day of its being founded, even until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And, now, send, strengthen thy cattle and all that thou hast in the field; every man and beast which is found in the field, and is not gathered into the house -- come down on them hath the hail, and they have died.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is fearing the word of Jehovah among the servants of Pharaoh hath caused his servants and his cattle to flee unto the houses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he who hath not set his heart unto the word of Jehovah leaveth his servants and his cattle in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Stretch forth thy hand towards the heavens, and there is hail in all the land of Egypt, on man, and on beast, and on every herb of the field in the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretcheth out his rod towards the heavens, and Jehovah hath given voices and hail, and fire goeth towards the earth, and Jehovah raineth hail on the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there is hail, and fire catching itself in the midst of the hail, very grievous, such as hath not been in all the land of Egypt since it hath become a nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hail smiteth in all the land of Egypt all that [is] in the field, from man even unto beast, and every herb of the field hath the hail smitten, and every tree of the field it hath broken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only in the land of Goshen, where the sons of Israel [are], there hath been no hail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh sendeth, and calleth for Moses and for Aaron, and saith unto them, `I have sinned this time, Jehovah [is] the Righteous, and I and my people [are] the Wicked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: make ye supplication unto Jehovah, and plead that there be no voices of God and hail, and I send you away, and ye add not to remain.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto him, `At my going out of the city, I spread my palms unto Jehovah -- the voices cease, and the hail is not any more, so that thou knowest that the earth [is] Jehovah's;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but thou and thy servants -- I have known that ye are not yet afraid of the face of Jehovah God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the flax and the barley have been smitten, for the barley [is] budding, and the flax forming flowers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the wheat and the rye have not been smitten, for they are late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth out from Pharaoh, [from] the city, and spreadeth his hands unto Jehovah, and the voices and the hail cease, and rain hath not been poured out to the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh seeth that the rain hath ceased, and the hail and the voices, and he continueth to sin, and hardeneth his heart, he and his servants;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the heart of Pharaoh is strong, and he hath not sent the sons of Israel away, as Jehovah hath spoken by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Go in unto Pharaoh, for I have declared hard his heart, and the heart of his servants, so that I set these My signs in their midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so that thou recountest in the ears of thy son, and of thy son's son, that which I have done in Egypt, and My signs which I have set among them, and ye have known that I [am] Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cometh in -- Aaron also -- unto Pharaoh, and they say unto him, `Thus said Jehovah, God of the Hebrews, Until when hast thou refused to be humbled at My presence? send My people away, and they serve Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for if thou art refusing to send My people away, lo, I am bringing in to-morrow the locust into thy border,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath covered the eye of the land, and none is able to see the land, and it hath eaten the remnant of that which is escaped, which is left to you from the hail, and it hath eaten every tree which is springing for you out of the field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have filled thy houses, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians, which neither thy fathers nor thy father's fathers have seen, since the day of their being on the ground unto this day,' -- and he turneth and goeth out from Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servants of Pharaoh say unto him, `Until when doth this [one] become a snare to us? send the men away, and they serve Jehovah their God; knowest thou not yet that Egypt hath perished?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses is brought back -- Aaron also -- unto Pharaoh, and he saith unto them, `Go, serve Jehovah your God; -- who and who [are] those going?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith, `With our young ones, and with our aged ones, we go, with our sons, and with our daughters, with our flock, and our herd, we go, for we have a festival to Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saith unto them, `Be it so, Jehovah [be] with you when I send you and your infants away; see -- for evil [is] before your faces;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not so! go now, ye who [are] men, and serve Jehovah, for that ye are seeking;' and [one] casteth them out from the presence of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Stretch out thy hand against the land of Egypt for the locust, and it goeth up against the land of Egypt, and doth eat every herb of the land -- all that the hail hath left.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretcheth out his rod against the land of Egypt, and Jehovah hath led an east wind over the land all that day, and all the night; the morning hath been, and the east wind hath lifted up the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the locust goeth up against all the land of Egypt, and resteth in all the border of Egypt -- very grievous: before it there hath not been such a locust as it, and after it there is none such;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it covereth the eye of all the land, and the land is darkened; and it eateth every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail hath left, and there hath not been left any green thing in the trees, or in the herb of the field, in all the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh hasteth to call for Moses and for Aaron, and saith, `I have sinned against Jehovah your God, and against you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, bear with, I pray you, my sin, only this time, and make ye supplication to Jehovah your God, that He turn aside from off me only this death.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he goeth out from Pharaoh, and maketh supplication unto Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah turneth a very strong sea wind, and it lifteth up the locust, and bloweth it into the Red Sea -- there hath not been left one locust in all the border of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah strengtheneth the heart of Pharaoh, and he hath not sent the sons of Israel away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Stretch out thy hand towards the heavens, and there is darkness over the land of Egypt, and the darkness is felt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretcheth out his hand towards the heavens, and there is darkness -- thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they have not seen one another, and none hath risen from his place three days; and to all the sons of Israel there hath been light in their dwellings.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh calleth unto Moses and saith, `Go ye, serve Jehovah, only your flock and your herd are stayed, your infants also go with you;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith, `Thou also dost give in our hand sacrifices and burnt-offerings, and we have prepared for Jehovah our God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also our cattle doth go with us, there is not left a hoof, for from it we do take to serve Jehovah our God; and we -- we know not how we do serve Jehovah till our going thither.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah strengtheneth the heart of Pharaoh, and he hath not been willing to send them away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh saith to him, `Go from me, take heed to thyself, add not to see my face, for in the day thou seest my face thou diest;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith, `Rightly hast thou spoken, I add not any more to see thy face.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `One plague more I do bring in on Pharaoh, and on Egypt, afterwards he doth send you away from this; when he is sending you away, he surely casteth you out altogether from this [place];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: speak, I pray thee, in the ears of the people, and they ask -- each man from his neighbour, and each woman from her neighbour, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah giveth the grace of the people in the eyes of the Egyptians; also the man Moses [is] very great in the land of Egypt, in the eyes of the servants of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith, `Thus said Jehovah, About midnight I am going out into the midst of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every first-born in the land of Egypt hath died, from the first-born of Pharaoh who is sitting on his throne, unto the first-born of the maid-servant who [is] behind the millstones, and all the first-born of beasts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there hath been a great cry in all the land of Egypt, such as there hath not been, and such as there is not again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And against all the sons of Israel a dog sharpeneth not its tongue, from man even unto beast, so that ye know that Jehovah doth make a separation between the Egyptians and Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all these thy servants have come down unto me, and bowed themselves to me, saying, Go out, thou and all the people who [are] at thy feet; and afterwards I do go out;' -- and he goeth out from Pharaoh in the heat of anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Pharaoh doth not hearken unto you, so as to multiply My wonders in the land of Egypt;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses and Aaron have done all these wonders before Pharaoh, and Jehovah strengtheneth Pharaoh's heart, and he hath not sent the sons of Israel out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses and unto Aaron, in the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This month [is] to you the chief of months -- it [is] the first to you of the months of the year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: speak ye unto all the company of Israel, saying, In the tenth of this month -- they take to them each man a lamb for the house of the fathers, a lamb for a house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `(And if the household be too few for a lamb, then hath he taken, he and his neighbour who is near unto his house, for the number of persons, each according to his eating ye do count for the lamb,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a lamb, a perfect one, a male, a son of a year, let be to you; from the sheep or from the goats ye do take [it].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath become a charge to you, until the fourteenth day of this month, and the whole assembly of the company of Israel have slaughtered it between the evenings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have taken of the blood, and have put on the two side-posts, and on the lintel over the houses in which they eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they have eaten the flesh in this night, roast with fire; with unleavened things and bitters they do eat it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye do not eat of it raw, or boiled at all in water, but roast with fire, its head with its legs, and with its inwards;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye do not leave of it till morning, and that which is remaining of it till morning with fire ye do burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thus ye do eat it: your loins girded, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand, and ye have eaten it in haste; it is Jehovah's passover,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have passed over through the land of Egypt during this night, and have smitten every first-born in the land of Egypt, from man even unto beast, and on all the gods of Egypt I do judgments; I [am] Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the blood hath become a sign for you on the houses where ye [are], and I have seen the blood, and have passed over you, and a plague is not on you for destruction in My smiting in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this day hath become to you a memorial, and ye have kept it a feast to Jehovah to your generations; -- a statute age-during; ye keep it a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days ye eat unleavened things; only -- in the first day ye cause leaven to cease out of your houses; for any one eating anything fermented from the first day till the seventh day, even that person hath been cut off from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in the first day [is] a holy convocation, and in the seventh day ye have a holy convocation; any work is not done in them, only that which is eaten by any person -- it alone is done by you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have observed the unleavened things, for in this self-same day I have brought out your hosts from the land of Egypt, and ye have observed this day to your generations -- a statute age-during.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `In the first [month], in the fourteenth day of the month, in the evening, ye do eat unleavened things until the one and twentieth day of the month, at evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seven days leaven is not found in your houses, for any [one] eating anything fermented -- that person hath been cut off from the company of Israel, among the sojourners or among the natives of the land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: anything fermented ye do not eat, in all your dwellings ye do eat unleavened things.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses calleth for all the elders of Israel, and saith unto them, `Draw out and take for yourselves [from] the flock, for your families, and slaughter the passover-sacrifice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have taken a bunch of hyssop, and have dipped [it] in the blood which [is] in the basin, and have struck [it] on the lintel, and on the two side-posts, from the blood which [is] in the basin, and ye, ye go not out each from the opening of his house till morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Jehovah hath passed on to smite the Egyptians, and hath seen the blood on the lintel, and on the two side-posts, and Jehovah hath passed over the opening, and doth not permit the destruction to come into your houses to smite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have observed this thing, for a statute to thee, and to thy sons -- unto the age;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been, when ye come in unto the land which Jehovah giveth to you, as He hath spoken, that ye have kept this service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath come to pass when your sons say unto you, What [is] this service ye have?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye have said, A sacrifice of passover it [is] to Jehovah, who passed over the houses of the sons of Israel in Egypt, in His smiting the Egyptians, and our houses He delivered.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people bow and do obeisance, and the sons of Israel go and do as Jehovah commanded Moses and Aaron; so have they done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, at midnight, that Jehovah hath smitten every first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh who is sitting on his throne, unto the first-born of the captive who [is] in the prison-house, and every first-born of beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh riseth by night, he and all his servants, and all the Egyptians, and there is a great cry in Egypt, for there is not a house where there is not [one] dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he calleth for Moses and for Aaron by night, and saith, `Rise, go out from the midst of my people, both ye and the sons of Israel, and go, serve Jehovah according to your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: both your flock and your herd take ye, as ye have spoken, and go; then ye have blessed also me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians are urgent on the people, hasting to send them away out of the land, for they said, `We are all dead;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the people taketh up its dough before it is fermented, their kneading-troughs [are] bound up in their garments on their shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel have done according to the word of Moses, and they ask from the Egyptians vessels of silver and vessels of gold, and garments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah hath given the grace of the people in the eyes of the Egyptians, and they cause them to ask, and they spoil the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel journey from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, apart from infants;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a great rabble also hath gone up with them, and flock and herd -- very much cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they bake with the dough which they have brought out from Egypt unleavened cakes, for it hath not fermented; for they have been cast out of Egypt, and have not been able to delay, and also provision they have not made for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dwelling of the sons of Israel which they have dwelt in Egypt [is] four hundred and thirty years;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it cometh to pass, at the end of four hundred and thirty years -- yea, it cometh to pass in this self-same day -- all the hosts of Jehovah have gone out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A night of watchings it [is] to Jehovah, to bring them out from the land of Egypt; it [is] this night to Jehovah of watchings to all the sons of Israel to their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses and Aaron, `This [is] a statute of the passover; Any son of a stranger doth not eat of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and any man's servant, the purchase of money, when thou hast circumcised him -- then he doth eat of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a settler or hired servant doth not eat of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in one house it is eaten, thou dost not carry out of the house [any] of the flesh without, and a bone ye do not break of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the company of Israel do keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a sojourner sojourneth with thee, and hath made a passover to Jehovah, every male of his [is] to be circumcised, and then he doth come near to keep it, and he hath been as a native of the land, but any uncircumcised one doth not eat of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one law is to a native, and to a sojourner who is sojourning in your midst.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the sons of Israel do as Jehovah commanded Moses and Aaron; so have they done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass in this self-same day, Jehovah hath brought out the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt, by their hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Sanctify to Me every first-born, opening any womb among the sons of Israel, among man and among beast; it [is] Mine.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto the people, `Remember this day [in] which ye have gone out from Egypt, from the house of servants, for by strength of hand hath Jehovah brought you out from this, and any thing fermented is not eaten;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To-day ye are going out, in the month of Abib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when Jehovah bringeth thee in unto the land of the Canaanite, and of the Hittite, and of the Amorite, and of the Hivite, and of the Jebusite, which He hath sworn to thy fathers to give to thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou hast done this service in this month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Seven days thou dost eat unleavened things, and in the seventh day [is] a feast to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unleavened things are eaten the seven days, and any thing fermented is not seen with thee; yea, leaven is not seen with thee in all thy border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast declared to thy son in that day, saying, `[It is] because of what Jehovah did to me, in my going out from Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been to thee for a sign on thy hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, so that the law of Jehovah is in thy mouth, for by a strong hand hath Jehovah brought thee out from Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast kept this statute at its appointed season from days to days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when Jehovah bringeth thee in unto the land of the Canaanite, as He hath sworn to thee and to thy fathers, and hath given it to thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that thou hast caused every one opening a womb to pass over to Jehovah, and every firstling -- the increase of beasts which thou hast: the males [are] Jehovah's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And every firstling of an ass thou dost ransom with a lamb, and if thou dost not ransom [it], then thou hast beheaded it: and every first-born of man among thy sons thou dost ransom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been, when thy son asketh thee hereafter, saying, What [is] this? that thou hast said unto him, By strength of hand hath Jehovah brought us out from Egypt, from a house of servants;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yea, it cometh to pass, when Pharaoh hath been pained to send us away, that Jehovah doth slay every first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of man even unto the first-born of beast; therefore I am sacrificing to Jehovah all opening a womb who [are] males, and every first-born of my sons I ransom;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been for a token on thy hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes, for by strength of hand hath Jehovah brought us out of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass in Pharaoh's sending the people away, that God hath not led them the way of the land of the Philistines, for it [is] near; for God said, `Lest the people repent in their seeing war, and have turned back towards Egypt;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and God turneth round the people the way of the wilderness of the Red Sea, and by fifties have the sons of Israel gone up from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh the bones of Joseph with him, for he certainly caused the sons of Israel to swear, saying, `God doth certainly inspect you, and ye have brought up my bones from this with you.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journey from Succoth, and encamp in Etham at the extremity of the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah is going before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them in the way, and by night in a pillar of fire, to give light to them, to go by day and by night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He removeth not the pillar of the cloud by day, and the pillar of the fire by night, [from] before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and they turn back and encamp before Pi-Hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-Zephon; over-against it ye do encamp by the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Pharaoh hath said of the sons of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut upon them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have strengthened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hath pursued after them, and I am honoured on Pharaoh, and on all his force, and the Egyptians have known that I [am] Jehovah;' and they do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is declared to the king of Egypt that the people hath fled, and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants is turned against the people, and they say, `What [is] this we have done? that we have sent Israel away from our service.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he harnesseth his chariot, and his people he hath taken with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he taketh six hundred chosen chariots, even all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over them all;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah strengtheneth the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursueth after the sons of Israel, and the sons of Israel are going out with a high hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Egyptians pursue after them, and all the chariot horses of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his force, overtake them, encamping by the sea, by Pi-Hahiroth, before Baal-Zephon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh hath drawn near, and the sons of Israel lift up their eyes, and lo, the Egyptians are journeying after them, and they fear exceedingly, and the sons of Israel cry unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they say unto Moses, `Because there are no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in a wilderness? what is this thou hast done to us -- to bring us out from Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not this the word which we spake unto thee in Egypt, saying, Cease from us, and we serve the Egyptians; for better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in a wilderness?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto the people, `Fear not, station yourselves, and see the salvation of Jehovah, which He doth for you to-day; for, as ye have seen the Egyptians to-day, ye add no more to see them -- to the age;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah doth fight for you, and ye keep silent.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `What? thou criest unto Me -- speak unto the sons of Israel, and they journey;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou, lift up thy rod, and stretch out thy hand towards the sea, and cleave it, and the sons of Israel go into the midst of the sea on dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I -- lo, I am strengthening the heart of the Egyptians, and they go in after them, and I am honoured on Pharaoh, and on all his force, on his chariots, and on his horsemen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Egyptians have known that I [am] Jehovah, in My being honoured on Pharaoh, on his chariots, and on his horsemen.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the messenger of God, who is going before the camp of Israel, journeyeth and goeth at their rear; and the pillar of the cloud journeyeth from their front, and standeth at their rear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cometh in between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel, and the cloud and the darkness are, and he enlighteneth the night, and the one hath not drawn near unto the other all the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretcheth out his hand towards the sea, and Jehovah causeth the sea to go on by a strong east wind all the night, and maketh the sea become dry ground, and the waters are cleaved,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel go into the midst of the sea, on dry land, and the waters [are] to them a wall, on their right and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians pursue, and go in after them (all the horses of Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen) unto the midst of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it cometh to pass, in the morning watch, that Jehovah looketh unto the camp of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud, and troubleth the camp of the Egyptians,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and turneth aside the wheels of their chariots, and they lead them with difficulty, and the Egyptians say, `Let us flee from the face of Israel, for Jehovah is fighting for them against the Egyptians.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Stretch out thy hand toward the sea, and the waters turn back on the Egyptians, on their chariots, and on their horsemen.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretcheth out his hand towards the sea, and the sea turneth back, at the turning of the morning, to its perennial flow, and the Egyptians are fleeing at its coming, and Jehovah shaketh off the Egyptians in the midst of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the waters turn back, and cover the chariots and the horsemen, even all the force of Pharaoh, who are coming in after them into the sea -- there hath not been left of them even one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel have gone on dry land in the midst of the sea, and the waters [are] to them a wall, on their right and on their left;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah saveth Israel in that day out of the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel seeth the Egyptians dead on the sea-shore,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Israel seeth the great hand with which Jehovah hath wrought against the Egyptians, and the people fear Jehovah, and remain stedfast in Jehovah, and in Moses His servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then singeth Moses and the sons of Israel this song to Jehovah, and they speak, saying: -- `I sing to Jehovah, For triumphing He hath triumphed; The horse and its rider He hath thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My strength and song is Jah, And He is become my salvation: This [is] my God, and I glorify Him; God of my father, and I exalt Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah [is] a man of battle; Jehovah [is] His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chariots of Pharaoh and his force He hath cast into the sea; And the choice of his captains Have sunk in the Red Sea!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The depths do cover them; They went down into the depths as a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thy right hand, O Jehovah, Is become honourable in power; Thy right hand, O Jehovah, Doth crush an enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the abundance of Thine excellency Thou throwest down Thy withstanders, Thou sendest forth Thy wrath -- It consumeth them as stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by the spirit of Thine anger Have waters been heaped together; Stood as a heap have flowings; Congealed have been depths In the heart of a sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The enemy said, I pursue, I overtake; I apportion spoil; Filled is my soul with them; I draw out my sword; My hand destroyeth them: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast blown with Thy wind The sea hath covered them; They sank as lead in mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who [is] like Thee among the gods, O Jehovah? Who [is] like Thee -- honourable in holiness -- Fearful in praises -- doing wonders?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast stretched out Thy right hand -- Earth swalloweth them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast led forth in Thy kindness The people whom Thou hast redeemed. Thou hast led on in Thy strength Unto Thy holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peoples have heard, they are troubled; Pain hath seized inhabitants of Philistia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then have chiefs of Edom been troubled: Mighty ones of Moab -- Trembling doth seize them! Melted have all inhabitants of Canaan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fall on them doth terror and dread; By the greatness of Thine arm They are still as a stone, Till Thy people pass over, O Jehovah; Till the people pass over Whom Thou hast purchased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost bring them in, And dost plant them In a mountain of Thine inheritance, A fixed place for Thy dwelling Thou hast made, O Jehovah; A sanctuary, O Lord, Thy hands have established;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah reigneth -- to the age, and for ever!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the horse of Pharaoh hath gone in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and Jehovah turneth back on them the waters of the sea, and the sons of Israel have gone on dry land in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Miriam the inspired one, sister of Aaron, taketh the timbrel in her hand, and all the women go out after her, with timbrels and with choruses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Miriam answereth to them: -- `Sing ye to Jehovah, For Triumphing He hath triumphed; The horse and its rider He hath thrown into the sea!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses causeth Israel to journey from the Red Sea, and they go out unto the wilderness of Shur, and they go three days in the wilderness, and have not found water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they come in to Marah, and have not been able to drink the waters of Marah, for they [are] bitter; therefore hath [one] called its name Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people murmur against Moses, saying, `What do we drink?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he crieth unto Jehovah, and Jehovah sheweth him a tree, and he casteth unto the waters, and the waters become sweet. There He hath made for them a statute, and an ordinance, and there He hath tried them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He saith, `If thou dost really hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, and dost that which is right in His eyes, and hast hearkened to His commands, and kept all His statutes: none of the sickness which I laid on the Egyptians do I lay on thee, for I, Jehovah, am healing thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they come to Elim, and there [are] twelve fountains of water, and seventy palm trees; and they encamp there by the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journey from Elim, and all the company of the sons of Israel come in unto the wilderness of Sin, which [is] between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month of their going out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the company of the sons of Israel murmur against Moses and against Aaron in the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel say unto them, `Oh that we had died by the hand of Jehovah in the land of Egypt, in our sitting by the flesh-pot, in our eating bread to satiety -- for ye have brought us out unto this wilderness to put all this assembly to death with hunger.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Lo, I am raining to you bread from the heavens -- and the people have gone out and gathered the matter of a day in its day -- so that I try them whether they walk in My law, or not;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been on the sixth day, that they have prepared that which they bring in, and it hath been double above that which they gather day [by] day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith -- Aaron also -- unto all the sons of Israel, `Evening -- and ye have known that Jehovah hath brought you out from the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and morning -- and ye have seen the honour of Jehovah, in His hearing your murmurings against Jehovah, and what [are] we, that ye murmur against us?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith, `In Jehovah's giving to you in the evening flesh to eat, and bread in the morning to satiety -- in Jehovah's hearing your murmurings, which ye are murmuring against Him, and what [are] we? your murmurings [are] not against us, but against Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, `Say unto all the company of the sons of Israel, Come ye near before Jehovah, for He hath heard your murmurings;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it cometh to pass, when Aaron is speaking unto all the company of the sons of Israel, that they turn towards the wilderness, and lo, the honour of Jehovah is seen in the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `I have heard the murmurings of the sons of Israel; speak unto them, saying, Between the evenings ye eat flesh, and in the morning ye are satisfied [with] bread, and ye have known that I [am] Jehovah your God.'
verses.speaker: Narrator
