verses.text: And it cometh to pass in the evening, that the quail cometh up, and covereth the camp, and in the morning there hath been the lying of dew round about the camp,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the lying of the dew goeth up, and lo, on the face of the wilderness a thin, bare thing, thin as hoar-frost on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel see, and say one unto another, `What [is] it?' for they have not known what it [is]; and Moses saith unto them, `It [is] the bread which Jehovah hath given to you for food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This [is] the thing which Jehovah hath commanded: Gather of it each according to his eating, an omer for a poll; and the number of your persons, take ye each for those in his tent.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel do so, and they gather, he who is [gathering] much, and he who is [gathering] little;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they measure with an omer, and he who is [gathering] much hath nothing over, and he who is [gathering] little hath no lack, each according to his eating they have gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto them, `Let no man leave of it till morning;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have not hearkened unto Moses, and some of them do leave of it till morning, and it bringeth up worms and stinketh; and Moses is wroth with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they gather it morning by morning, each according to his eating; when the sun hath been warm, then it hath melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass on the sixth day, they have gathered a second bread, two omers for one, and all the princes of the company come in, and declare to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saith unto them, `It [is] that which Jehovah hath spoken [of]; a rest -- a holy sabbath to Jehovah -- [is] to-morrow; that which ye bake, bake; and that which ye boil, boil; and all that is over, let rest for yourselves in charge till the morning.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they let it rest until the morning, as Moses hath commanded, and it hath not stank, and a worm hath not been in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith, `Eat it to-day, for to-day [is] a sabbath to Jehovah; to-day ye find it not in the field:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six days ye do gather it, and in the seventh day -- the sabbath -- in it there is none.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass on the seventh day, some of the people have gone out to gather, and have not found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `How long have ye refused to keep My commands, and My laws?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: see, because Jehovah hath given to you the sabbath, therefore He is giving to you on the sixth day bread of two days; abide ye each [in] his place, no one doth go out from his place on the seventh day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people rest on the seventh day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the house of Israel call its name Manna, and it [is] as coriander seed, white; and its taste [is] as a cake with honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith, `This [is] the thing which Jehovah hath commanded: Fill the omer with it, for a charge for your generations, so that they see the bread which I have caused you to eat in the wilderness, in My bringing you out from the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, `Take one pot, and put there the fulness of the omer of manna, and let it rest before Jehovah, for a charge for your generations;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Jehovah hath given commandment unto Moses, so doth Aaron let it rest before the Testimony, for a charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel have eaten the manna forty years, until their coming in unto the land to be inhabited; the manna they have eaten till their coming in unto the extremity of the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the omer is a tenth of the ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the company of the sons of Israel journey from the wilderness of Sin, on their journeyings, by the command of Jehovah, and encamp in Rephidim, and there is no water for the people to drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the people strive with Moses, and say, `Give us water, and we drink.' And Moses saith to them, `What? -- ye strive with me, what? -- ye try Jehovah?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the people thirst there for water, and the people murmur against Moses, and say, `Why [is] this? -- thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to put us to death, also our sons and our cattle, with thirst.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses crieth to Jehovah, saying, `What do I to this people? yet a little, and they have stoned me.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Pass over before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel, and thy rod with which thou hast smitten the River take in thy hand, and thou hast gone:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, I am standing before thee there on the rock in Horeb, and thou hast smitten on the rock, and waters have come out from it, and the people have drunk.' And Moses doth so before the eyes of the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he calleth the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the `strife' of the sons of Israel, and because of their `trying' Jehovah, saying, `Is Jehovah in our midst or not?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amalek cometh, and fighteth with Israel in Rephidim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith unto Joshua, `Choose for us men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to-morrow I am standing on the top of the hill, and the rod of God in my hand.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua doth as Moses hath said to him, to fight with Amalek, and Moses, Aaron, and Hur, have gone up [to] the top of the height;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath come to pass, when Moses lifteth up his hand, that Israel hath been mighty, and when he letteth his hands rest, that Amalek hath been mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hands of Moses [are] heavy, and they take a stone, and set [it] under him, and he sitteth on it: and Aaron and Hur have taken hold on his hands, on this side one, and on that one, and his hands are stedfast till the going in of the sun;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joshua weakeneth Amalek and his people by the mouth of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Write this, a memorial in a Book, and set [it] in the ears of Joshua, that I do utterly wipe away the remembrance of Amalek from under the heavens;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses buildeth an altar, and calleth its name Jehovah-Nissi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saith, `Because a hand [is] on the throne of Jah, war [is] to Jehovah with Amalek from generation -- generation.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro priest of Midian, father-in-law of Moses, heareth all that God hath done for Moses, and for Israel his people, that Jehovah hath brought out Israel from Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jethro, father-in-law of Moses, taketh Zipporah, wife of Moses, besides her parents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her two sons, of whom the name of the one [is] Gershom, for he said, `a sojourner I have been in a strange land:'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the name of the other [is] Eliezer, for, `the God of my father [is] for my help, and doth deliver me from the sword of Pharaoh.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, father-in-law of Moses, cometh, and his sons, and his wife, unto Moses, unto the wilderness where he is encamping -- the mount of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith unto Moses, `I, thy father-in-law, Jethro, am coming unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth out to meet his father-in-law, and boweth himself, and kisseth him, and they ask one at another of welfare, and come into the tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses recounteth to his father-in-law all that Jehovah hath done to Pharaoh, and to the Egyptians, on account of Israel, all the travail which hath found them in the way, and Jehovah doth deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro rejoiceth for all the good which Jehovah hath done to Israel, whom He hath delivered from the hand of the Egyptians;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jethro saith, `Blessed [is] Jehovah, who hath delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians, and from the hand of Pharaoh -- who hath delivered this people from under the hand of the Egyptians;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now I have known that Jehovah [is] greater than all the gods, for in the thing they have acted proudly -- [He is] above them!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, father-in-law of Moses, taketh a burnt-offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron cometh in, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with the father-in-law of Moses, before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass on the morrow, that Moses sitteth to judge the people, and the people stand before Moses, from the morning unto the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the father-in-law of Moses seeth all that he is doing to the people, and saith, `What [is] this thing which thou art doing to the people? wherefore art thou sitting by thyself, and all the people standing by thee from morning till evening?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith to his father-in-law, `Because the people come unto me to seek God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they have a matter, it hath come unto me, and I have judged between a man and his neighbour, and made known the statutes of God, and His laws.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the father-in-law of Moses saith unto him, `The thing which thou art doing [is] not good;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost surely wear away, both thou, and this people which [is] with thee, for the thing is too heavy for thee, thou art not able to do it by thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Now, hearken to my voice, I counsel thee, and God is with thee: be thou for the people over-against God, and thou hast brought in the things unto God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast warned them [concerning] the statutes and the laws, and hast made known to them the way in which they go, and the work which they do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou -- thou dost provide out of all the people men of ability, fearing God, men of truth, hating dishonest gain, and hast placed [these] over them, heads of thousands, heads of hundreds, heads of fifties, and heads of tens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have judged the people at all times; and it hath come to pass, every great matter they bring in unto thee, and every small matter they judge themselves; and lighten it from off thyself, and they have borne with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If thou dost this thing, and God hath commanded thee, then thou hast been able to stand, and all this people also goeth in unto its place in peace.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses hearkeneth to the voice of his father-in-law, and doth all that he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses chooseth men of ability out of all Israel, and maketh them chiefs over the people, heads of thousands, heads of hundreds, heads of fifties, and heads of tens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have judged the people at all times; the hard matter they bring in unto Moses, and every small matter they judge themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sendeth his father-in-law away, and he goeth away unto his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third month of the going out of the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt, in this day they have come into the wilderness of Sinai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they journey from Rephidim, and enter the wilderness of Sinai, and encamp in the wilderness; and Israel encampeth there before the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses hath gone up unto God, and Jehovah calleth unto him out of the mount, saying, `Thus dost thou say to the house of Jacob, and declare to the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye -- ye have seen that which I have done to the Egyptians, and I bear you on eagles' wings, and bring you in unto Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, if ye really hearken to My voice, then ye have kept My covenant, and been to Me a peculiar treasure more than all the peoples, for all the earth [is] Mine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye -- ye are to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation: these [are] the words which thou dost speak unto the sons of Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cometh, and calleth for the elders of the people, and setteth before them all these words which Jehovah hath commanded him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people answer together and say, `All that Jehovah hath spoken we do;' and Moses returneth the words of the people unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Lo, I am coming unto thee in the thickness of the cloud, so that the people hear in My speaking with thee, and also believe in thee to the age;' and Moses declareth the words of the people unto Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Go unto the people; and thou hast sanctified them to-day and to-morrow, and they have washed their garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have been prepared for the third day; for on the third day doth Jehovah come down before the eyes of all the people, on mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a border [for] the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, going up into the mount, or coming against its extremity; whoever is coming against the mount is certainly put to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a hand cometh not against him, for he is certainly stoned or shot through, whether beast or man it liveth not; in the drawing out of the jubilee cornet they go up into the mount.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cometh down from the mount unto the people, and sanctifieth the people, and they wash their garments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith unto the people, `Be ye prepared for the third day, come not nigh unto a woman.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, on the third day, while it is morning, that there are voices, and lightnings, and a heavy cloud, on the mount, and the sound of a trumpet very strong; and all the people who [are] in the camp do tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses bringeth out the people to meet God from the camp, and they station themselves at the lower part of the mount,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and mount Sinai [is] wholly a smoke from the presence of Jehovah, who hath come down on it in fire, and its smoke goeth up as smoke of the furnace, and the whole mount trembleth exceedingly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sound of the trumpet is going on, and very strong; Moses speaketh, and God doth answer him with a voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah cometh down on mount Sinai, unto the top of the mount, and Jehovah calleth for Moses unto the top of the mount, and Moses goeth up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Go down, protest to the people, lest they break through unto Jehovah to see, and many of them have fallen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also the priests who are coming nigh unto Jehovah do sanctify themselves, lest Jehovah break forth on them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Jehovah, `The people [is] unable to come up unto mount Sinai, for Thou -- Thou hast protested to us, saying, Make a border [for] the mount, then thou hast sanctified it.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto him, `Go, descend, then thou hast come up, thou, and Aaron with thee; and the priests and the people do not break through, to come up unto Jehovah, lest He break forth upon them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth down unto the people, and saith unto them: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And God speaketh all these words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I [am] Jehovah thy God, who hath brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of a house of servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou hast no other Gods before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not make to thyself a graven image, or any likeness which [is] in the heavens above, or which [is] in the earth beneath, or which [is] in the waters under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou dost not bow thyself to them, nor serve them: for I, Jehovah thy God, [am] a zealous God, charging iniquity of fathers on sons, on the third [generation], and on the fourth, of those hating Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and doing kindness to thousands, of those loving Me and keeping My commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not take up the name of Jehovah thy God for a vain thing, for Jehovah acquitteth not him who taketh up His name for a vain thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Remember the Sabbath-day to sanctify it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six days thou dost labour, and hast done all thy work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the seventh day [is] a Sabbath to Jehovah thy God; thou dost not do any work, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, thy man-servant, and thy handmaid, and thy cattle, and thy sojourner who is within thy gates, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for six days hath Jehovah made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that [is] in them, and resteth in the seventh day; therefore hath Jehovah blessed the Sabbath-day, and doth sanctify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Honour thy father and thy mother, so that thy days are prolonged on the ground which Jehovah thy God is giving to thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not answer against thy neighbour a false testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not desire the house of thy neighbour, thou dost not desire the wife of thy neighbour, or his man-servant, or his handmaid, or his ox, or his ass, or anything which [is] thy neighbour's.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people are seeing the voices, and the flames, and the sound of the trumpet, and the mount smoking; and the people see, and move, and stand afar off,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say unto Moses, `Speak thou with us, and we hear, and let not God speak with us, lest we die.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto the people, `Fear not, for to try you hath God come, and in order that His fear may be before your faces -- that ye sin not.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people stand afar off, and Moses hath drawn nigh unto the thick darkness where God [is].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Thus dost thou say unto the sons of Israel: Ye -- ye have seen that from the heavens I have spoken with you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye do not make with Me gods of silver, even gods of gold ye do not make to yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `An altar of earth thou dost make for Me, and thou hast sacrificed on it thy burnt-offerings and thy peace-offerings, thy flock and thy herd; in every place where I cause My name to be remembered I come in unto thee, and have blessed thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if an altar of stones thou dost make to Me, thou dost not build them of hewn work; when thy tool thou hast waved over it, then thou dost pollute it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither dost thou go up by steps on Mine altar, that thy nakedness be not revealed upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And these [are] the judgments which thou dost set before them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou buyest a Hebrew servant -- six years he doth serve, and in the seventh he goeth out as a freeman for nought;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if by himself he cometh in, by himself he goeth out; if he [is] owner of a wife, then his wife hath gone out with him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if his lord give to him a wife, and she hath borne to him sons or daughters -- the wife and her children are her lord's, and he goeth out by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if the servant really say: I have loved my lord, my wife, and my sons -- I do not go out free;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then hath his lord brought him nigh unto God, and hath brought him nigh unto the door, or unto the side-post, and his lord hath bored his ear with an awl, and he hath served him -- to the age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man selleth his daughter for a handmaid, she doth not go out according to the going out of the men-servants;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if evil in the eyes of her lord, so that he hath not betrothed her, then he hath let her be ransomed; to a strange people he hath not power to sell her, in his dealing treacherously with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And if to his son he betroth her, according to the right of daughters he doth to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If another [woman] he take for him, her food, her covering, and her habitation, he doth not withdraw;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if these three he do not to her, then she hath gone out for nought, without money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `He who smiteth a man so that he hath died, is certainly put to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as to him who hath not laid wait, and God hath brought to his hand, I have even set for thee a place whither he doth flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man doth presume against his neighbour to slay him with subtilty, from Mine altar thou dost take him to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who smiteth his father or his mother is certainly put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who stealeth a man, and hath sold him, and he hath been found in his hand, is certainly put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And he who is reviling his father or his mother is certainly put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when men contend, and a man hath smitten his neighbour with a stone, or with the fist, and he die not, but hath fallen on the bed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he rise, and hath gone up and down without on his staff, then hath the smiter been acquitted; only his cessation he giveth, and he is thoroughly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man smiteth his man-servant or his handmaid, with a rod, and he hath died under his hand -- he is certainly avenged;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only if he remain a day, or two days, he is not avenged, for he [is] his money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when men strive, and have smitten a pregnant woman, and her children have come out, and there is no mischief, he is certainly fined, as the husband of the woman doth lay upon him, and he hath given through the judges;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if there is mischief, then thou hast given life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man smiteth the eye of his man-servant, or the eye of his handmaid, and hath destroyed it, as a freeman he doth send him away for his eye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if a tooth of his man-servant or a tooth of his handmaid he knock out, as a freeman he doth send him away for his tooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when an ox doth gore man or woman, and they have died, the ox is certainly stoned, and his flesh is not eaten, and the owner of the ox [is] acquitted;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if the ox is [one] accustomed to gore heretofore, and it hath been testified to its owner, and he doth not watch it, and it hath put to death a man or woman, the ox is stoned, and its owner also is put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If atonement is laid upon him, then he hath given the ransom of his life, according to all that is laid upon him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whether it gore a son or gore a daughter, according to this judgment it is done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If the ox gore a man-servant or a handmaid, thirty silver shekels he doth give to their lord, and the ox is stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man doth open a pit, or when a man doth dig a pit, and doth not cover it, and an ox or ass hath fallen thither, --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit doth repay, money he doth give back to its owner, and the dead is his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man's ox doth smite the ox of his neighbour, and it hath died, then they have sold the living ox, and halved its money, and also the dead one they do halve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or, it hath been known that the ox is [one] accustomed to gore heretofore, and its owner doth not watch it, he certainly repayeth ox for ox, and the dead is his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man doth steal an ox or sheep, and hath slaughtered it or sold it, five of the herd he doth repay for the ox, and four of the flock for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If in the breaking through, the thief is found, and he hath been smitten, and hath died, there is no blood for him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if the sun hath risen upon him, blood [is] for him, he doth certainly repay; if he have nothing, then he hath been sold for his theft;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if the theft is certainly found in his hand alive, whether ox, or ass, or sheep -- double he repayeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man depastureth a field or vineyard, and hath sent out his beast, and it hath pastured in the field of another, [of] the best of his field, and the best of his vineyard, he doth repay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When fire goeth forth, and hath found thorns, and a stack, or the standing corn, or the field, hath been consumed, he who causeth the burning doth certainly repay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man doth give unto his neighbour silver, or vessels to keep, and it hath been stolen out of the man's house; if the thief is found, he repayeth double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If the thief is not found, then the master of the house hath been brought near unto God, whether he hath not put forth his hand against the work of his neighbour;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for every matter of transgression, for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, for any lost thing of which it is said that it is his; unto God cometh the matter of them both; he whom God doth condemn, he repayeth double to his neighbour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When a man doth give unto his neighbour an ass, or ox, or sheep, or any beast to keep, and it hath died, or hath been hurt, or taken captive, none seeing --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: an oath of Jehovah is between them both, that he hath not put forth his hand against the work of his neighbour, and its owner hath accepted, and he doth not repay;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if it is certainly stolen from him, he doth repay to its owner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if it is certainly torn, he bringeth it in -- a witness; the torn thing he doth not repay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man doth ask [anything] from his neighbour, and it hath been hurt or hath died -- its owner not being with it -- he doth certainly repay;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if its owner [is] with it, he doth not repay, -- if it [is] a hired thing, it hath come for its hire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And when a man doth entice a virgin who [is] not betrothed, and hath lain with her, he doth certainly endow her to himself for a wife;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if her father utterly refuse to give her to him, money he doth weigh out according to the dowry of virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `A witch thou dost not keep alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Whoever lieth with a beast is certainly put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `He who is sacrificing to a god, save to Jehovah alone, is devoted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a sojourner thou dost not oppress, nor crush him, for sojourners ye have been in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Any widow or orphan ye do not afflict;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou dost really afflict him, surely if he at all cry unto Me, I certainly hear his cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mine anger hath burned, and I have slain you by the sword, and your wives have been widows, and your sons orphans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `If thou dost lend My poor people with thee money, thou art not to him as a usurer; thou dost not lay on him usury;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if thou dost at all take in pledge the garment of thy neighbour, during the going in of the sun thou dost return it to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it alone is his covering, it [is] his garment for his skin; wherein doth he lie down? and it hath come to pass, when he doth cry unto Me, that I have heard, for I [am] gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `God thou dost not revile, and a prince among thy people thou dost not curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thy fulness and thy liquids thou dost not delay; the first-born of thy sons thou dost give to Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so thou dost to thine ox, to thy sheep; seven days it is with its dam, on the eighth day thou dost give it to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye are holy men to Me, and flesh torn in the field ye do not eat, to a dog ye do cast it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not lift up a vain report; thou dost not put thy hand with a wicked man to be a violent witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou art not after many to evil, nor dost thou testify concerning a strife, to turn aside after many to cause [others] to turn aside;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a poor man thou dost not honour in his strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou meetest thine enemy's ox or his ass going astray, thou dost certainly turn it back to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when thou seest the ass of him who is hating thee crouching under its burden, then thou hast ceased from leaving [it] to it -- thou dost certainly leave [it] with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not turn aside the judgment of thy needy one in his strife;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from a false matter thou dost keep far off, and an innocent and righteous man thou dost not slay; for I do not justify a wicked man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a bribe thou dost not take; for the bribe bindeth the open-[eyed], and perverteth the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a sojourner thou dost not oppress, and ye -- ye have known the soul of the sojourner, for sojourners ye have been in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And six years thou dost sow thy land, and hast gathered its increase;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the seventh thou dost release it, and hast left it, and the needy of thy people have eaten, and their leaving doth the beast of the field eat; so dost thou to thy vineyard -- to thine olive-yard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Six days thou dost do thy work, and on the seventh day thou dost rest, so that thine ox and thine ass doth rest, and the son of thine handmaid and the sojourner is refreshed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in all that which I have said unto you ye do take heed; and the name of other gods ye do not mention; it is not heard on thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Three times thou dost keep a feast to Me in a year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Feast of Unleavened things thou dost keep; seven days thou dost eat unleavened things, as I have commanded thee, at the time appointed [in] the month of Abib; for in it thou hast come forth out of Egypt, and ye do not appear [in] My presence empty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Feast of Harvest, the first fruits of thy works which thou sowest in the field; and the Feast of the In-Gathering, in the outgoing of the year, in thy gathering thy works out of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Three times in a year do all thy males appear before the face of the Lord Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not sacrifice on a fermented thing the blood of My sacrifice, and the fat of My festival doth not remain till morning;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the beginning of the first-fruits of thy ground thou dost bring into the house of Jehovah thy God; thou dost not boil a kid in its mother's milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Lo, I am sending a messenger before thee to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee in unto the place which I have prepared;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be watchful because of his presence, and hearken to his voice, rebel not against him, for he beareth not with your transgression, for My name [is] in his heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for, if thou diligently hearken to his voice, and hast done all that which I speak, then I have been at enmity with thine enemies, and have distressed those distressing thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `For My messenger goeth before thee, and hath brought thee in unto the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, and I have cut them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not bow thyself to their gods, nor serve them, nor do according to their doings, but dost utterly devote them, and thoroughly break their standing pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And ye have served Jehovah your God, and He hath blessed thy bread and thy water, and I have turned aside sickness from thine heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there is not a miscarrying and barren one in thy land; the number of thy days I fulfil:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My terror I send before thee, and I have put to death all the people among whom thou comest, and I have given the neck of all thine enemies unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have sent the hornet before thee, and it hath cast out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I cast them not out from before thee in one year, lest the land be a desolation, and the beast of the field hath multiplied against thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: little [by] little I cast them out from before thee, till thou art fruitful, and hast inherited the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have set thy border from the Red Sea, even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness unto the River: for I give into your hand the inhabitants of the land, and thou hast cast them out from before thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou dost not make a covenant with them, and with their gods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they do not dwell in thy land, lest they cause thee to sin against Me when thou servest their gods, when it becometh a snare to thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto Moses He said, `Come up unto Jehovah, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel, and ye have bowed yourselves afar off;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses hath drawn nigh by himself unto Jehovah; and they draw not nigh, and the people go not up with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses cometh in, and recounteth to the people all the words of Jehovah, and all the judgments, and all the people answer -- one voice, and say, `All the words which Jehovah hath spoken we do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses writeth all the words of Jehovah, and riseth early in the morning, and buildeth an altar under the hill, and twelve standing pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sendeth the youths of the sons of Israel, and they cause burnt-offerings to ascend, and sacrifice sacrifices of peace-offerings to Jehovah -- calves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh half of the blood, and putteth in basins, and half of the blood hath he sprinkled on the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he taketh the Book of the Covenant, and proclaimeth in the ears of the people, and they say, `All that which Jehovah hath spoken we do, and obey.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh the blood, and sprinkleth on the people, and saith, `Lo, the blood of the covenant which Jehovah hath made with you, concerning all these things.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth up, Aaron also, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they see the God of Israel, and under His feet [is] as the white work of the sapphire, and as the substance of the heavens for purity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unto those of the sons of Israel who are near He hath not put forth His hand, and they see God, and eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Come up unto Me to the mount, and be there, and I give to thee the tables of stone, and the law, and the command, which I have written to direct them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses riseth -- Joshua his minister also -- and Moses goeth up unto the mount of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unto the elders he hath said, `Abide ye for us in this [place], until that we turn back unto you, and lo, Aaron and Hur [are] with you -- he who hath matters doth come nigh unto them.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses goeth up unto the mount, and the cloud covereth the mount;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the honour of Jehovah doth tabernacle on mount Sinai, and the cloud covereth it six days, and He calleth unto Moses on the seventh day from the midst of the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the appearance of the honour of Jehovah [is] as a consuming fire on the top of the mount, before the eyes of the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses goeth into the midst of the cloud, and goeth up unto the mount, and Moses is on the mount forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Speak unto the sons of Israel, and they take for Me a heave-offering; from every man whose heart impelleth him ye do take My heave-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] the heave-offering which ye take from them; gold, and silver, and brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and linen, and goats' [hair],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rams' skins made red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil, and for the perfume of the spices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shoham stones, and stones for setting for an ephod, and for a breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they have made for Me a sanctuary, and I have tabernacled in their midst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to all that which I am shewing thee, the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all its vessels, even so ye do make [it].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they have made an ark of shittim wood; two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast overlaid it [with] pure gold, within and without thou dost overlay it, and thou hast made on it a ring of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast cast for it four rings of gold, and hast put [them] on its four feet, even two rings on its one side, and two rings on its second side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made staves of shittim wood, and hast overlaid them [with] gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast brought the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark by them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the rings of the ark are the staves, they are not turned aside from it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put unto the ark the testimony which I give unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a mercy-seat of pure gold, two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made two cherubs of gold, beaten work dost thou make them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make thou one cherub at the end on this side, and one cherub at the end on that; at the mercy-seat ye do make the cherubs on its two ends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the cherubs have been spreading out wings on high, covering the mercy-seat over with their wings, and their faces [are] one towards another -- towards the mercy-seat are the faces of the cherubs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast put the mercy-seat on the ark above, and unto the ark thou dost put the testimony which I give unto thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have met with thee there, and have spoken with thee from off the mercy-seat (from between the two cherubs, which [are] on the ark of the testimony) all that which I command thee concerning the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a table of shittim wood, two cubits its length, and a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast overlaid it [with] pure gold, and hast made for it a crown of gold round about,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast made for it a border of a handbreadth round about, and hast made a crown of gold to its border round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made to it four rings of gold, and hast put the rings on the four corners, which [are] to its four feet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: over-against the border are the rings for places for staves to bear the table;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made the staves of shittim wood, and hast overlaid them with gold, and the table hath been borne with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made its dishes, and its bowls, and its covers, and its cups, with which they pour out; of pure gold thou dost make them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put on the table bread of the presence before Me continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a candlestick of pure gold, of beaten work is the candlestick made; its base, and its branch, its calyxes, its knops, and its flowers are of the same;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and six branches are coming out of its sides, three branches of the candlestick out of the one side, and three branches of the candlestick out of the second side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three calyxes made like almonds in the one branch, a knop and a flower, and three calyxes made like almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; so for the six branches which are coming out from the candlestick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And in the candlestick [are] four calyxes made like almonds, its knops and its flowers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, [are] to the six branches which are coming out of the candlestick;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their knops and their branches are of the same, all of it one beaten work of pure gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made its seven lamps, and [one] hath caused its lights to go up, and it hath given light over-against its front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And its snuffers and its snuff dishes [are] of pure gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of a talent of pure gold he doth make it, with all these vessels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And see thou and do [them] by their pattern which thou art shewn in the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou dost make the tabernacle: ten curtains of twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet; [with] cherubs, work of a designer, thou dost make them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the length of the one curtain [is] eight and twenty by the cubit, and the breadth of the one curtain four by the cubit, one measure [is] to all the curtains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five of the curtains are joining one unto another, and five curtains are joining one to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain, at the end in the joining; and so thou makest in the edge of the outermost curtain, in the joining of the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fifty loops thou dost make in the one curtain, and fifty loops thou dost make in the edge of the curtain which [is] in the joining of the second, causing the loops to take hold one unto another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made fifty hooks of gold, and hast joined the curtains one to another by the hooks, and the tabernacle hath been one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made curtains of goats' [hair], for a tent over the tabernacle; thou dost make eleven curtains:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the length of the one curtain [is] thirty by the cubit, and the breadth of the one curtain four by the cubit; one measure [is] to the eleven curtains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast joined the five curtains apart, and the six curtains apart, and hast doubled the six curtains over-against the front of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain, the outermost in the joining, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which is joining the second;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made fifty hooks of brass, and hast brought in the hooks into the loops, and hast joined the tent, and it hath been one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the superfluity in the curtains of the tent -- the half of the curtain which is superfluous -- hath spread over the hinder part of the tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cubit on this side, and the cubit on that, in the superfluity in the length of the curtains of the tent, is spread out over the sides of the tabernacle, on this and on that, to cover it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made a covering for the tent, of rams' skins made red, and a covering of badgers' skins above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made the boards for the tabernacle, of shittim wood, standing up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ten cubits [is] the length of the board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of the one board;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two handles [are] to the one board, joined one unto another; so thou dost make for all the boards of the tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made the boards of the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side southward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forty sockets of silver thou dost make under the twenty boards, two sockets under the one board for its two handles, and two sockets under the other board for its two handles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And for the second side of the tabernacle, for the north side, [are] twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward, thou dost make six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two boards thou dost make for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they are pairs beneath, and together they are pairs above its head unto the one ring; so is it for them both, they are for the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have been eight boards, and their sockets of silver [are] sixteen sockets, two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made bars of shittim wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the boards of the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle at the two sides, westward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one hath caused the middle bar in the midst of the boards to reach from end unto end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the boards thou dost overlay [with] gold, and their rings thou dost make of gold places for bars, and hast overlaid their bars with gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast raised up the tabernacle according to its fashion which thou hast been shewn in the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of a designer; he maketh it [with] cherubs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put it on four pillars of shittim wood, overlaid [with] gold, their pegs [are] of gold, on four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast put the vail under the hooks, and hast brought in thither within the vail the ark of the testimony; and the vail hath made a separation for you between the holy and the holy of holies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast put the mercy-seat on the ark of the testimony, in the holy of holies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast set the table at the outside of the vail, and the candlestick over-against the table on the side of the tabernacle southward, and the table thou dost put on the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a covering for the opening of the tent, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of an embroiderer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made for the covering five pillars of shittim [wood], and hast overlaid them [with] gold, their pegs [are] of gold, and thou hast cast for them five sockets of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made the altar of shittim wood, five cubits the length, and five cubits the breadth -- the altar is square -- and three cubits its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou hast made its horns on its four corners, its horns are of the same, and thou hast overlaid it [with] brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou hast made its pots to remove its ashes, and its shovels, and its bowls, and its forks, and its fire-pans, even all its vessels thou dost make of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made for it a grate of net-work of brass, and hast made on the net four rings of brass on its four extremities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast put it under the compass of the altar beneath, and the net hath been unto the middle of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made staves for the altar, staves of shittim wood, and hast overlaid them [with] brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the staves have been brought into the rings, and the staves have been on the two sides of the altar in bearing it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hollow with boards thou dost make it, as it hath been shewed thee in the mount, so do they make [it].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward, hangings for the court of twined linen, a hundred by the cubit [is] the length for the one side,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets [are] of brass, the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so for the north side in length, hangings of a hundred [cubits] in length, and its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets [are] of brass, the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And [for] the breadth of the court at the west side [are] hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And [for] the breadth of the court at the east side, eastward, [are] fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hangings at the side [are] fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at the second side [are] hangings fifteen [cubits], their pillars three, and their sockets three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And for the gate of the court a covering of twenty cubits, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of an embroiderer; their pillars four, their sockets four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars of the court round about [are] filleted [with] silver, their pegs [are] silver, and their sockets brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The length of the court [is] a hundred by the cubit, and the breadth fifty by fifty, and the height five cubits, of twined linen, and their sockets [are] brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even all the vessels of the tabernacle, in all its service, and all its pins, and all the pins of the court, [are] brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou -- thou dost command the sons of Israel, and they bring unto thee pure beaten olive oil for the light, to cause the lamp to go up continually;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the tent of meeting, at the outside of the vail, which [is] over the testimony, doth Aaron -- his sons also -- arrange it from evening till morning before Jehovah -- a statute age-during to their generations, from the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou, bring thou near unto thee Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him, from the midst of the sons of Israel, for his being priest to Me, [even] Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, sons of Aaron;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made holy garments for Aaron thy brother, for honour and for beauty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou -- thou dost speak unto all the wise of heart, whom I have filled [with] a spirit of wisdom, and they have made the garments of Aaron to sanctify him for his being priest to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And these [are] the garments which they make: a breastplate, and an ephod, and an upper robe, and an embroidered coat, a mitre, and a girdle; yea, they have made holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and for his sons, for his being priest to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And they take the gold, and the blue, and the purple, and the scarlet, and the linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of a designer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it hath two shoulders joining at its two ends, and it is joined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the girdle of his ephod which [is] on him, according to its work, is of the same, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast taken the two shoham stones, and hast opened on them the names of the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the remaining six on the second stone, according to their births;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the work of an engraver in stone, openings of a signet, thou dost open the two stones by the names of the sons of Israel; turned round, embroidered [with] gold, thou dost make them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast set the two stones on the shoulders of the ephod -- stones of memorial to the sons of Israel -- and Aaron hath borne their names before Jehovah, on his two shoulders, for a memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made embroidered things of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two chains of pure gold, wreathed work thou dost make them, work of thick bands, and thou hast put the thick chains on the embroidered things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a breastplate of judgment, work of a designer; according to the work of the ephod thou dost make it; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen thou dost make it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is square, doubled, a span its length, and a span its breadth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast set in it settings of stone, four rows of stone; a row of sardius, topaz, and carbuncle [is] the first row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row [is] emerald, sapphire, and diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row [is] opal, agate, and amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row [is] beryl, and onyx, and jasper; embroidered with gold are they in their settings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the stones are according to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve, according to their names, openings of a signet, each by his name are they for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made on the breastplate wreathed chains, work of thick bands, of pure gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made on the breastplate two rings of gold, and hast put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put the two thick bands of gold on the two rings at the ends of the breastplate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two ends of the two thick bands thou dost put on the two embroidered things, and thou hast put [them] on the shoulders of the ephod over-against its face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made two rings of gold, and hast set them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its border, which [is] over-against the ephod within;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made two rings of gold, and hast put them on the two shoulders of the ephod, beneath, over-against its front, over-against its joining, above the girdle of the ephod,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they bind the breastplate by its rings unto the rings of the ephod with a ribbon of blue, to be above the girdle of the ephod, and the breastplate is not loosed from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Aaron hath borne the names of the sons of Israel in the breastplate of judgment, on his heart, in his going in unto the sanctuary, for a memorial before Jehovah continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast put unto the breastplate of judgment the Lights and the Perfections, and they have been on the heart of Aaron, in his going in before Jehovah, and Aaron hath borne the judgment of the sons of Israel on his heart before Jehovah continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made the upper robe of the ephod completely of blue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the opening for its head hath been in its midst, a border is to its opening round about, work of a weaver, as the opening of a habergeon there is to it; it is not rent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made on its hem pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, on its hem round about, and bells of gold in their midst round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a bell of gold and a pomegranate, a bell of gold and a pomegranate [are] on the hems of the upper robe round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And it hath been on Aaron to minister in, and its sound hath been heard in his coming in unto the sanctuary before Jehovah, and in his going out, and he doth not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a flower of pure gold, and hast opened on it -- openings of a signet -- `Holy to Jehovah;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put it on a blue ribbon, and it hath been on the mitre -- over-against the front of the mitre it is;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been on the forehead of Aaron, and Aaron hath borne the iniquity of the holy things which the sons of Israel do hallow, even all their holy gifts; and it hath been on his forehead continually for a pleasing thing for them before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast embroidered the coat of linen, and hast made a mitre of linen, and a girdle thou dost make -- work of an embroiderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And for the sons of Aaron thou dost make coats, and thou hast made for them girdles, yea, bonnets thou dost make for them, for honour and for beauty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast clothed Aaron thy brother with them, and his sons with him, and hast anointed them, and hast consecrated their hand, and hast sanctified them, and they have been priests to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And make thou for them linen trousers to cover the naked flesh: they are from the loins even unto the thighs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have been on Aaron and on his sons, in their going in unto the tent of meeting, or in their drawing nigh unto the altar to minister in the sanctuary, and they do not bear iniquity nor have they died; a statute age-during to him, and to his seed after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] the thing which thou dost to them, to hallow them, for being priests to Me: Take one bullock, a son of the herd, and two rams, perfect ones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bread unleavened, and cakes unleavened anointed with oil, of fine wheaten flour thou dost make them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put them on one basket, and hast brought them near in the basket, also the bullock and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Aaron and his sons thou dost bring near unto the opening of the tent of meeting, and hast bathed them with water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast taken the garments, and hast clothed Aaron with the coat, and the upper robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and hast girded him with the girdle of the ephod,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast set the mitre on his head, and hast put the holy crown on the mitre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast taken the anointing oil, and hast poured [it] on his head, and hast anointed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And his sons thou dost bring near, and hast clothed them [with] coats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast girded them [with] a girdle (Aaron and his sons), and hast bound on them bonnets; and the priesthood hath been theirs by a statute age-during, and thou hast consecrated the hand of Aaron, and the hand of his sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast brought near the bullock before the tent of meeting, and Aaron hath laid -- his sons also -- their hands on the head of the bullock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast slaughtered the bullock before Jehovah, at the opening of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast taken of the blood of the bullock, and hast put [it] on the horns of the altar with thy finger, and all the blood thou dost pour out at the foundation of the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast taken all the fat which is covering the inwards, and the redundance on the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, and hast made perfume on the altar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, thou dost burn with fire at the outside of the camp; it [is] a sin-offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the one ram thou dost take, and Aaron and his sons have laid their hands on the head of the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast slaughtered the ram, and hast taken its blood, and hast sprinkled [it] on the altar round about,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the ram thou dost cut into its pieces, and hast washed its inwards, and its legs, and hast put [them] on its pieces, and on its head;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made perfume with the whole ram on the altar. It [is] a burnt-offering to Jehovah, a sweet fragrance; a fire-offering it [is] to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast taken the second ram, and Aaron hath laid -- his sons also -- their hands on the head of the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast slaughtered the ram, and hast taken of its blood, and hast put on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the great toe of their right foot, and hast sprinkled the blood on the altar round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast taken of the blood which [is] on the altar, and of the anointing oil, and hast sprinkled on Aaron, and on his garments, and on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him, and he hath been hallowed, he, and his garments, and his sons, and the garments of his sons with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast taken from the ram the fat, and the fat tail, and the fat which is covering the inwards, and the redundance on the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat which [is] on them, and the right leg, for it [is] a ram of consecration,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one round cake of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one thin cake out of the basket of the unleavened things which [is] before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast set the whole on the hands of Aaron, and on the hands of his sons, and hast waved them -- a wave-offering before Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast taken them out of their hand, and hast made perfume on the altar beside the burnt-offering, for sweet fragrance before Jehovah; a fire-offering it [is] to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast taken the breast from the ram of the consecration which [is] for Aaron, and hast waved it -- a wave-offering before Jehovah, and it hath become thy portion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast sanctified the breast of the wave-offering, and the leg of the heave-offering, which hath been waved, and which hath been lifted up from the ram of the consecration, of that which [is] for Aaron, and of that which [is] for his sons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath been for Aaron and for his sons, by a statute age-during from the sons of Israel, for it [is] a heave-offering; and it is a heave offering from the sons of Israel, from the sacrifices of their peace-offerings -- their heave-offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the holy garments which are Aaron's, are for his sons after him, to be anointed in them, and to consecrate in them their hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seven days doth the priest in his stead (of his sons) put them on, when he goeth in unto the tent of meeting, to minister in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the ram of the consecration thou dost take, and hast boiled its flesh in the holy place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron hath eaten -- his sons also -- the flesh of the ram, and the bread which [is] in the basket, at the opening of the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have eaten those things by which there is atonement to consecrate their hand, to sanctify them; and a stranger doth not eat -- for they [are] holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if there be left of the flesh of the consecration or of the bread till the morning, then thou hast burned that which is left with fire; it is not eaten, for it [is] holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast done thus to Aaron and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded thee; seven days thou dost consecrate their hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a bullock, a sin-offering, thou dost prepare daily for the atonements, and thou hast atoned for the altar, in thy making atonement on it, and hast anointed it to sanctify it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seven days thou dost make atonement for the altar, and hast sanctified it, and the altar hath been most holy; all that is coming against the altar is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And this [is] that which thou dost prepare on the altar; two lambs, sons of a year, daily continually;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the one lamb thou dost prepare in the morning, and the second lamb thou dost prepare between the evenings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth [deal] of fine flour, mixed with beaten oil, a fourth part of a hin, and a libation, a fourth part of a hin, of wine, [is] for the one lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the second lamb thou dost prepare between the evenings; according to the present of the morning, and according to its libation, thou dost prepare for it, for sweet fragrance, a fire-offering, to Jehovah: --
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a continual burnt-offering for your generations, at the opening of the tent of meeting, before Jehovah, whither I am met with you, to speak unto thee there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have met there with the sons of Israel, and it hath been sanctified by My honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I have sanctified the tent of meeting, and the altar, and Aaron and his sons I sanctify for being priests to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have tabernacled in the midst of the sons of Israel, and have become their God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have known that I [am] Jehovah their God, who hath brought them out of the land of Egypt, that I may tabernacle in their midst; I [am] Jehovah their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made an altar [for] making perfume; [of] shittim wood thou dost make it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a cubit its length, and a cubit its breadth, (it is square), and two cubits its height; its horns [are] of the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast overlaid it with pure gold, its top, and its sides round about, and its horns; and thou hast made to it a crown of gold round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two rings of gold thou dost make to it under its crown; on its two ribs thou dost make [them], on its two sides, and they have become places for staves, to bear it with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made the staves of shittim wood, and hast overlaid them with gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast put it before the vail, which [is] by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy-seat which [is] over the testimony, whither I am met with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And Aaron hath made perfume on it, perfume of spices, morning by morning; in his making the lamps right he doth perfume it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in Aaron's causing the lamps to go up between the evenings, he doth perfume it; a continual perfume before Jehovah to your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Ye do not cause strange perfume to go up upon it, and burnt-offering, and present, and libation ye do not pour out on it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron hath made atonement on its horns, once in a year, by the blood of the sin-offering of atonements; once in a year doth he make atonement for it, to your generations; it [is] most holy to Jehovah.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `When thou takest up the sum of the sons of Israel for their numbers, then they have given each an atonement [for] his soul to Jehovah in their being numbered, and there is no plague among them in their being numbered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `This they do give, every one passing over unto those numbered, half a shekel, by the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel [is] twenty gerahs); half a shekel [is] the heave-offering to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every one passing over unto those numbered, from a son of twenty years and upwards, doth give the heave-offering of Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the rich doth not multiply, and the poor doth not diminish from the half-shekel, to give the heave-offering of Jehovah, to make atonement for your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast taken the atonement-money from the sons of Israel, and hast given it for the service of the tent of meeting; and it hath been to the sons of Israel for a memorial before Jehovah, to make atonement for your souls.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast made a laver of brass (and its base of brass), for washing; and thou hast put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and hast put water there;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron and his sons have washed at it their hands and their feet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in their going in unto the tent of meeting they wash [with] water, and die not; or in their drawing nigh unto the altar to minister, to perfume a fire-offering to Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they have washed their hands and their feet, and they die not, and it hath been to them a statute age-during, to him and to his seed to their generations.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou, take to thyself principal spices, wild honey five hundred [shekels]; and spice-cinnamon, the half of that, two hundred and fifty; and spice-cane two hundred and fifty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cassia five hundred, by the shekel of the sanctuary, and olive oil a hin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made it a holy anointing oil, a compound mixture, work of a compounder; it is a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast anointed with it the tent of meeting, and the ark of the testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and all its vessels, and the candlestick and its vessels, and the altar of perfume,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt-offering and all its vessels, and the laver and its base;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast sanctified them, and they have been most holy; all that is coming against them is holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron and his sons thou dost anoint, and hast sanctified them for being priests to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And unto the sons of Israel thou dost speak, saying, A holy anointing oil is this to Me, to your generations;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on flesh of man it is not poured, and with its proper proportion ye make none like it; it [is] holy; it is holy to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a man who compoundeth [any] like it, or who putteth of it on a stranger -- hath even been cut off from his people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Take to thee spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum, spices and pure frankincense; they are part for part;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast made it a perfume, a compound, work of a compounder, salted, pure, holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast beaten [some] of it small, and hast put of it before the testimony, in the tent of meeting, whither I am met with thee; most holy it is to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `As to the perfume which thou makest, with its proper proportion ye do not make to yourselves, holy it is to thee to Jehovah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a man who maketh [any] like it -- to be refreshed by it -- hath even been cut off from his people.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `See, I have called by name Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator
