verses.text: and I fill him [with] the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to devise devices to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in graving of stone for settings, and in graving of wood to work in all work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And I, lo, I have given with him Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, and in the heart of every wise-hearted one I have given wisdom, and they have made all that which I have commanded thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The tent of meeting, and the ark of testimony, and the mercy-seat which [is] on it, and all the vessels of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and its vessels, and the pure candlestick and all its vessels, and the altar of the perfume,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of the burnt-offering and all its vessels, and the laver and its base,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the coloured garments, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, for acting as priests in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the anointing oil, and the perfume of the spices for the sanctuary; according to all that I have commanded thee -- they do.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou, speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, Only, My sabbaths ye do keep, for it [is] a sign between Me and you, to your generations, to know that I, Jehovah, am sanctifying you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye have kept the sabbath, for it [is] holy to you, he who is polluting it is certainly put to death -- for any who doeth work in it -- that person hath even been cut off from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Six days is work done, and in the seventh day [is] a sabbath of holy rest to Jehovah; any who doeth work in the sabbath-day is certainly put to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel have observed the sabbath; to keep the sabbath to their generations [is] a covenant age-during,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: between Me and the sons of Israel it [is] a sign -- to the age; for six days Jehovah made the heavens and the earth, and in the seventh day He hath ceased, and is refreshed.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He giveth unto Moses, when He finisheth speaking with him in mount Sinai, two tables of the testimony, tables of stone, written by the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people see that Moses is delaying to come down from the mount, and the people assemble against Aaron, and say unto him, `Rise, make for us gods who go before us, for this Moses -- the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt -- we have not known what hath happened to him.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron saith unto them, `Break off the rings of gold which [are] in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring in unto me;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people themselves break off the rings of gold which [are] in their ears, and bring in unto Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he receiveth from their hand, and doth fashion it with a graving tool, and doth make it a molten calf, and they say, `These thy gods, O Israel, who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron seeth, and buildeth an altar before it, and Aaron calleth, and saith, `A festival to Jehovah -- to-morrow;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they rise early on the morrow, and cause burnt-offerings to ascend, and bring nigh peace-offerings; and the people sit down to eat and to drink, and rise up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Go, descend, for thy people whom thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt hath done corruptly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they have turned aside hastily from the way that I have commanded them; they have made for themselves a molten calf, and bow themselves to it, and sacrifice to it, and say, These thy gods, O Israel, who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `I have seen this people, and lo, it [is] a stiff-necked people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, let Me alone, and My anger doth burn against them, and I consume them, and I make thee become a great nation.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses appeaseth the face of Jehovah his God, and saith, `Why, O Jehovah, doth Thine anger burn against Thy people, whom Thou hast brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a strong hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: why do the Egyptians speak, saying, For evil He brought them out to slay them among mountains, and to consume them from off the face of the ground? turn back from the heat of Thine anger, and repent of the evil against Thy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Be mindful of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, Thy servants, to whom Thou hast sworn by Thyself, and unto whom Thou speakest: I multiply your seed as stars of the heavens, and all this land, as I have said, I give to your seed, and they have inherited to the age;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah repenteth of the evil which He hath spoken of doing to His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses turneth, and goeth down from the mount, and the two tables of the testimony [are] in his hand, tables written on both their sides, on this and on that [are] they written;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the tables are the work of God, and the writing is the writing of God, graven on the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua heareth the voice of the people in their shouting, and saith unto Moses, `A noise of battle in the camp!'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith, `It is not the voice of the crying of might, nor is it the voice of the crying of weakness -- a voice of singing I am hearing.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, when he hath drawn near unto the camp, that he seeth the calf, and the dancing, and the anger of Moses burneth, and he casteth out of his hands the tables, and breaketh them under the mount;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he taketh the calf which they have made, and burneth [it] with fire, and grindeth until [it is] small, and scattereth on the face of the waters, and causeth the sons of Israel to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Aaron, `What hath this people done to thee, that thou hast brought in upon it a great sin?'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron saith, `Let not the anger of my lord burn; thou -- thou hast known the people that it [is] in evil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they say to me, Make for us gods, who go before us, for this Moses -- the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt -- we have not known what hath happened to him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I say to them, Whoso hath gold, let them break [it] off, and they give to me, and I cast it into the fire, and this calf cometh out.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses seeth the people that it [is] unbridled, for Aaron hath made it unbridled for contempt among its withstanders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses standeth in the gate of the camp, and saith, `Who [is] for Jehovah? -- unto me!' and all the sons of Levi are gathered unto him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he saith to them, `Thus said Jehovah, God of Israel, Put each his sword by his thigh, pass over and turn back from gate to gate through the camp, and slay each his brother, and each his friend, and each his relation.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Levi do according to the word of Moses, and there fall of the people on that day about three thousand men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses saith, `Consecrate your hand to-day to Jehovah, for a man [is] against his son, and against his brother, so as to bring on you to-day a blessing.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, on the morrow, that Moses saith unto the people, `Ye -- ye have sinned a great sin, and now I go up unto Jehovah, if so be I atone for your sin.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses turneth back unto Jehovah, and saith, `Oh this people hath sinned a great sin, that they make to themselves a god of gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, if Thou takest away their sin -- and if not -- blot me, I pray thee, out of Thy book which Thou hast written.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Whoso hath sinned against Me -- I blot him out of My book;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and now, go, lead the people whithersoever I have spoken to thee of; lo, My messenger goeth before thee, and in the day of my charging -- then I have charged upon them their sin.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah plagueth the people, because they made the calf which Aaron made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, `Go, ascend from this [place], thou and the people, whom thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt, unto the land which I have sworn to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, To thy seed I give it,'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (and I have sent before thee a messenger, and have cast out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite,)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto a land flowing with milk and honey, for I do not go up in thy midst, for thou [art] a stiff-necked people -- lest I consume thee in the way.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people hear this sad thing, and mourn; and none put his ornaments on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Say unto the sons of Israel, Ye [are] a stiff-necked people; one moment -- I come up into thy midst, and have consumed thee; and now, put down thine ornaments from off thee, and I know what I do to thee;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel take off their ornaments at mount Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses taketh the tent, and hath stretched it out at the outside of the camp, afar off from the camp, and hath called it, `Tent of Meeting;' and it hath come to pass, every one seeking Jehovah goeth out unto the tent of meeting, which [is] at the outside of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it hath come to pass, at the going out of Moses unto the tent, all the people rise, and have stood, each at the opening of his tent, and have looked expectingly after Moses, until his going into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it hath come to pass, at the going in of Moses to the tent, the pillar of the cloud cometh down, and hath stood at the opening of the tent, and He hath spoken with Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people have seen the pillar of the cloud standing at the opening of the tent, and all the people have risen and bowed themselves, each at the opening of his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah hath spoken unto Moses face unto face, as a man speaketh unto his friend; and he hath turned back unto the camp, and his minister Joshua, son of Nun, a youth, departeth not out of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto Jehovah, `See, Thou art saying unto me, Bring up this people, and Thou hast not caused me to know whom Thou dost send with me; and Thou hast said, I have known thee by name, and also thou hast found grace in Mine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And now, if, I pray Thee, I have found grace in Thine eyes, cause me to know, I pray Thee, Thy way, and I know Thee, so that I find grace in Thine eyes, and consider that this nation [is] Thy people;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He saith, `My presence doth go, and I have given rest to thee.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saith unto Him, `If Thy presence is not going -- take us not up from this [place];
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in what is it known now, that I have found grace in Thine eyes -- I and Thy people -- is it not in Thy going with us? and we have been distinguished -- I and Thy people -- from all the people who [are] on the face of the ground.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Even this thing which thou hast spoken I do; for thou hast found grace in Mine eyes, and I know thee by name.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saith, `Shew me, I pray Thee, Thine honour;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He saith, `I cause all My goodness to pass before thy face, and have called concerning the Name of Jehovah before thee, and favoured him whom I favour, and loved him whom I love.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saith also, `Thou art unable to see My face, for man doth not see Me, and live;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah also saith, `Lo, a place [is] by Me, and thou hast stood on the rock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it hath come to pass, in the passing by of Mine honour, that I have set thee in a cleft of the rock, and spread out My hands over thee, until My passing by,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have turned aside My hands, and thou hast seen My back parts, and My face is not seen.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Hew for thyself two tables of stone like the first, and I have written on the tables the words which were on the first tables which thou hast broken;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be prepared at morning, and thou hast come up in the morning unto mount Sinai, and hast stood before Me there, on the top of the mount,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and no man cometh up with thee, and also no man is seen in all the mount, also the flock and the herd do not feed over-against that mount.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he heweth two tables of stone like the first, and Moses riseth early in the morning, and goeth up unto mount Sinai, as Jehovah commanded him, and he taketh in his hand two tables of stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah cometh down in a cloud, and stationeth Himself with him there, and calleth in the Name of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jehovah passeth over before his face, and calleth: `Jehovah, Jehovah God, merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in kindness and truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: keeping kindness for thousands, taking away iniquity, and transgression, and sin, and not entirely acquitting, charging iniquity of fathers on children, and on children's children, on a third [generation], and on a fourth.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses hasteth, and boweth to the earth, and doth obeisance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saith, `If, I pray Thee, I have found grace in Thine eyes, O my Lord, let my Lord, I pray Thee, go in our midst (for it [is] a stiff-necked people), and thou hast forgiven our iniquity and our sin, and hast inherited us.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He saith, `Lo, I am making a covenant: before all thy people I do wonders, which have not been done in all the earth, or in any nation, and all the people in whose midst thou [art] have seen the work of Jehovah, for it [is] fearful that which I am doing with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Observe for thyself that which I am commanding thee to-day: lo, I am casting out from before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitant of the land into which thou art going, lest it become a snare in thy midst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for their altars ye break down, and their standing pillars ye shiver, and its shrines ye cut down;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for ye do not bow yourselves to another god -- for Jehovah, whose name [is] Zealous, is a zealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitant of the land, and they have gone a-whoring after their gods, and have sacrificed to their gods, and [one] hath called to thee, and thou hast eaten of his sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast taken of their daughters to thy sons, and their daughters have gone a-whoring after their gods, and have caused thy sons to go a-whoring after their gods;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a molten god thou dost not make to thyself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The feast of unleavened things thou dost keep; seven days thou dost eat unleavened things, as I have commanded thee, at an appointed time, the month of Abib: for in the month of Abib thou didst come out from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `All opening a womb [are] Mine, and every firstling of thy cattle born a male, ox or sheep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the firstling of an ass thou dost ransom with a lamb; and if thou dost not ransom, then thou hast beheaded it; every first-born of thy sons thou dost ransom, and they do not appear before Me empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Six days thou dost work, and on the seventh day thou dost rest; in ploughing-time and in harvest thou dost rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And a feast of weeks thou dost observe for thyself; first-fruits of wheat-harvest; and the feast of in-gathering, at the revolution of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Three times in a year do all thy males appear before the Lord Jehovah, God of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I dispossess nations from before thee, and have enlarged thy border, and no man doth desire thy land in thy going up to appear before Jehovah thy God three times in a year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `Thou dost not slaughter with a fermented thing the blood of My sacrifice; and the sacrifice of the feast of the passover doth not remain till morning:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the first of the first-fruits of the land thou dost bring into the house of Jehovah thy God; thou dost not boil a kid in its mother's milk.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah saith unto Moses, `Write for thyself these words, for, according to the tenor of these words I have made with thee a covenant, and with Israel.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he is there with Jehovah forty days and forty nights; bread he hath not eaten, and water he hath not drunk; and he writeth on the tables the matters of the covenant -- the ten matters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, when Moses is coming down from mount Sinai (and the two tables of the testimony [are] in the hand of Moses in his coming down from the mount), that Moses hath not known that the skin of his face hath shone in His speaking with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron seeth -- all the sons of Israel also -- Moses, and lo, the skin of his face hath shone, and they are afraid of coming nigh unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses calleth unto them, and Aaron and all the princes in the company return unto him, and Moses speaketh unto them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and afterwards have all the sons of Israel come nigh, and he chargeth them with all that Jehovah hath spoken with him in mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses finisheth speaking with them, and putteth on his face a vail;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the going in of Moses before Jehovah to speak with Him, he turneth aside the vail until his coming out; and he hath come out and hath spoken unto the sons of Israel that which he is commanded;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sons of Israel have seen the face of Moses that the skin of the face of Moses hath shone, and Moses hath put back the vail on his face until his going in to speak with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses assembleth all the company of the sons of Israel, and saith unto them, `These [are] the things which Jehovah hath commanded -- to do them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days is work done, and on the seventh day there is to you a holy [day], a sabbath of rest to Jehovah; any who doeth work in it is put to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye do not burn a fire in any of your dwellings on the sabbath-day.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses speaketh unto all the company of the sons of Israel, saying, `This [is] the thing which Jehovah hath commanded, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take ye from among you a heave-offering to Jehovah; every one whose heart [is] willing doth bring it, -- the heave-offering of Jehovah, -- gold, and silver, and brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and linen, and goats' [hair],
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rams' skins made red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and oil for the light, and spices for the anointing oil, and for the spice perfume,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shoham stones, and stones for settings, for an ephod, and for a breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And all the wise-hearted among you come in, and make all that Jehovah hath commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The tabernacle, its tent, and its covering, its hooks, and its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The ark and its staves, the mercy-seat, and the vail of the covering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The table and its staves, and all its vessels, and the bread of the presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the candlestick for the light, and its vessels, and its lamps, and the oil for the light,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And the altar of perfume, and its staves, and the anointing oil, and the spice perfume, and the covering of the opening at the opening of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The altar of burnt-offering and the brazen grate which it hath, its staves, and all its vessels, the laver and its base,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The hangings of the court, its pillars, and their sockets, and the covering of the gate of the court,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `The coloured garments, to do service in the sanctuary, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons to act as priest in.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the company of the sons of Israel go out from the presence of Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they come in -- every man whom his heart hath lifted up, and every one whom his spirit hath made willing -- they have brought in the heave-offering of Jehovah for the work of the tent of meeting, and for all its service, and for the holy garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they come in -- the men with the women -- every willing-hearted one -- they have brought in nose-ring, and ear-ring, and seal-ring, and necklace, all golden goods, even every one who hath waved a wave-offering of gold to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every man with whom hath been found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and linen, and goats' [hair], and rams' skins made red, and badgers' skins, have brought [them] in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every one lifting up a heave-offering of silver and brass have brought in the heave-offering of Jehovah; and every one with whom hath been found shittim wood for any work of the service brought [it] in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every wise-hearted woman hath spun with her hands, and they bring in yarn, the blue, and the purple, the scarlet, and the linen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the women whose heart hath lifted them up in wisdom, have spun the goats' [hair].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the princes have brought in the shoham stones, and the stones for settings, for the ephod, and for the breastplate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the spices, and the oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the spice perfume;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every man and woman (whom their heart hath made willing to bring in for all the work which Jehovah commanded to be done by the hand of Moses) [of] the sons of Israel brought in a willing-offering to Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses saith unto the sons of Israel, `See, Jehovah hath called by name Bezaleel, son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He doth fill him [with] the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even to devise devices to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in graving of stones for settings, and in graving of wood to work in any work of design.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And to direct He hath put in his heart, he and Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath filled them with wisdom of heart to do every work, of engraver, and designer, and embroiderer (in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in linen), and weaver, who do any work, and of designers of designs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bezaleel, and Aholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whom Jehovah hath given wisdom and understanding to know to do every work of the service of the sanctuary, have done according to all that Jehovah commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses calleth unto Bezaleel, and unto Aholiab, and unto every wise-hearted man in whose heart Jehovah hath given wisdom, every one whom his heart lifted up, to come near unto the work to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they take from before Moses all the heave-offering which the sons of Israel have brought in for the work of the service of the sanctuary to do it; and still they have brought in unto him a willing-offering morning by morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the wise men, who are doing all the work of the sanctuary, come each from his work which they are doing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and speak unto Moses, saying, `The people are multiplying to bring in more than sufficient for the service of the work which Jehovah commanded to make.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses commandeth, and they cause a voice to pass over through the camp, saying, `Let not man or woman make any more work for the heave-offering of the sanctuary;' and the people are restrained from bringing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the work hath been sufficient for them, for all the work, to do it, and to leave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the wise-hearted ones among the doers of the work make the tabernacle; ten curtains of twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, [with] cherubs, work of a designer, he hath made them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the one curtain [is] eight and twenty by the cubit, and the breadth of the one curtain four by the cubit; one measure [is] to all the curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he joineth the five curtains one unto another, and the [other] five curtains he hath joined one unto another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain, at the end, in the joining; so he hath made in the edge of the outmost curtain, in the joining of the second;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fifty loops he hath made in the one curtain, and fifty loops hath he made in the end of the curtain which [is] in the joining of the second; the loops are taking hold one on another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh fifty hooks of gold, and joineth the curtains one unto another by the hooks, and the tabernacle is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh curtains of goats' [hair] for a tent over the tabernacle; eleven curtains he hath made them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the length of the one curtain [is] thirty by the cubit, and the breadth of the one curtain [is] four cubits; one measure [is] to the eleven curtains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he joineth the five curtains apart, and the six curtains apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh fifty loops on the outer edge of the curtain, in the joining; and fifty loops he hath made on the edge of the curtain which is joining the second;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh fifty hooks of brass to join the tent -- to be one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh a covering for the tent of rams' skins made red, and a covering of badgers' skins above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ten cubits [is] the length of the [one] board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of the [one] board;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: two handles [are] to the one board, joined one unto another; so he hath made for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forty sockets of silver he hath made under the twenty boards, two sockets under the one board for its two handles, and two sockets under the other board for its two handles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the second side of the tabernacle, for the north side, he hath made twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under the one board, and two sockets under the other board;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the sides of the tabernacle, westward, hath he made six boards;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two boards hath he made for the corners of the tabernacle, in the two sides;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they have been twins below, and together they are twins at its head, at the one ring; so he hath done to both of them at the two corners;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there have been eight boards; and their sockets of silver [are] sixteen sockets, two sockets under the one board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh bars of shittim wood, five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the boards of the second side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle, for the sides westward;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh the middle bar to enter into the midst of the boards from end to end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the boards he hath overlaid with gold, and their rings he hath made of gold, places for bars, and he overlayeth the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of a designer he hath made it, [with] cherubs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh for it four pillars of shittim [wood], and overlayeth them with gold; their pegs [are] of gold; and he casteth for them four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh a covering for the opening of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, work of an embroiderer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also its five pillars, and their pegs; and he overlaid their tops and their fillets [with] gold, and their five sockets [are] brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bezaleel maketh the ark of shittim wood, two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he overlayeth it with pure gold within and without, and maketh for it a wreath of gold round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he casteth for it four rings of gold, on its four feet, even two rings on its one side, and two rings on its second side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh staves of shittim wood, and overlayeth them with gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he bringeth in the staves into the rings, by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh a mercy-seat of pure gold, two cubits and a half its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh two cherubs of gold, of beaten work he hath made them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one cherub at the end on this [side], and one cherub at the end on that, out of the mercy-seat he hath made the cherubs, at its two ends;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the cherubs are spreading out wings on high, covering over the mercy-seat with their wings, and their faces [are] one towards another; towards the mercy-seat have the faces of the cherubs been.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the table of shittim wood; two cubits its length, and a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and overlayeth it with pure gold, and maketh for it a wreath of gold round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh for it a border of a handbreadth round about, and maketh a wreath of gold for its border round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he casteth for it four rings of gold, and putteth the rings on the four corners which [are] to its four feet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: over-against the border have the rings been, places for staves to bear the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the staves of shittim wood, and overlayeth them with gold, to bear the table;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh the vessels which [are] upon the table, its dishes, and its bowls, and its cups, and the cups by which they pour out, of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the candlestick of pure gold; of beaten work he hath made the candlestick, its base, and its branch, its calyxes, its knops, and its flowers, have been of the same;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and six branches are coming out of its sides, three branches of the candlestick out of its one side, and three branches of the candlestick out of its second side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three calyxes, made like almonds, in the one branch, a knop and a flower; and three calyxes, made like almonds, in another branch, a knop and a flower; so to the six branches which are coming out of the candlestick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the candlestick [are] four calyxes, made like almonds, its knops, and its flowers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a knop under the two branches of the same, and a knop under the two branches of the same, and a knop under the two branches of the same, [are] to the six branches which are coming out of it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their knops and their branches have been of the same; all of it one beaten work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff-dishes, of pure gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of a talent of pure gold he hath made it, and all its vessels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the perfume-altar of shittim wood; a cubit its length, and a cubit its breadth (square), and two cubits its height; its horns have been of the same;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he overlayeth it with pure gold, its top and its sides round about, and its horns; and he maketh for it a wreath of gold round about;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two rings of gold he hath made for it under its wreath, at its two corners, at its two sides, for places for staves to bear it with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the staves of shittim wood, and overlayeth them with gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh the holy anointing oil, and the pure spice-perfume -- work of a compounder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the altar of burnt-offering of shittim wood, five cubits its length, and five cubits its breadth (square), and three cubits its height;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh its horns on its four corners; its horns have been of the same; and he overlayeth it with brass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the sprinkling-pans, the forks, and the fire-pans; all its vessels he hath made of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh for the altar a brazen grate of net-work, under its border beneath, unto its midst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he casteth four rings for the four ends of the brazen grate -- places for bars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh the staves of shittim wood, and overlayeth them with brass;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he bringeth in the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it with them; hollow [with] boards he made it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the laver of brass, and its base of brass, with the looking-glasses of the women assembling, who have assembled at the opening of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the court; at the south side southward, the hangings of the court of twined linen, a hundred by the cubit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their pillars [are] twenty, and their brazen sockets twenty, the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the north side, a hundred by the cubit, their pillars [are] twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the west side [are] hangings, fifty by the cubit; their pillars [are] ten, and their sockets ten; the pegs of the pillars and their fillets [are] silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the east side eastward fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings on the side [are] fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the second side at the gate of the court, on this and on that, [are] hangings, fifteen cubits, their pillars three, and their sockets three;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the hangings of the court round about [are] of twined linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sockets for the pillars of brass, the pegs of the pillars and their fillets of silver, and the overlaying of their tops of silver, and all the pillars of the court are filleted with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the covering of the gate of the court [is] the work of an embroiderer, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen; and twenty cubits [is] the length, and the height with the breadth five cubits, over-against the hangings of the court;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their pillars [are] four, and their sockets of brass four, their pegs [are] of silver, and the overlaying of their tops and their fillets [are] of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the pins for the tabernacle, and for the court round about, [are] of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numberings of the tabernacle (the tabernacle of testimony), which hath been numbered by the command of Moses, the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Bezaleel son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, hath made all that Jehovah commanded Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with him [is] Aholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and designer, and embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and in linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold which is prepared for the work in all the work of the sanctuary (and it is the gold of the wave-offering) [is] twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the silver of those numbered of the company [is] a hundred talents, and a thousand and seven hundred and five and seventy shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a bekah for a poll (half a shekel, by the shekel of the sanctuary,) for every one who is passing over unto those numbered, from a son of twenty years and upwards, for six hundred thousand, and three thousand, and five hundred and fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a hundred talents of silver are to cast the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the vail; a hundred sockets for the hundred talents, a talent for a socket;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the thousand and seven hundred and five and seventy he hath made pegs for the pillars, and overlaid their tops, and filleted them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brass of the wave-offering [is] seventy talents, and two thousand and four hundred shekels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he maketh with it the sockets of the opening of the tent of meeting, and the brazen altar, and the brazen grate which it hath, and all the vessels of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the gate of the court, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the blue, and the purple, and the scarlet, they made coloured garments, to minister in the sanctuary; and they make the holy garments which [are] for Aaron, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the ephod, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they expand the plates of gold, and have cut off wires to work in the midst of the blue, and in the midst of the purple, and in the midst of the scarlet, and in the midst of the linen -- work of a designer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shoulder-pieces they have made for it, joining; at its two ends it is joined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the girdle of his ephod which [is] on it is of the same, according to its work, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they prepare the shoham stones, set, embroidered [with] gold, opened with openings of a signet, by the names of the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he setteth them on the shoulders of the ephod -- stones of memorial for the sons of Israel, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the breastplate, work of a designer, like the work of the ephod, of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it hath been square; double they have made the breastplate, a span its length, and a span its breadth, doubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fill in it four rows of stones; a row of a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle [is] the one row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row an opal, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper -- set, embroidered [with] gold, in their settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the stones, according to the names of the sons of Israel, are twelve, according to their names, openings of a signet, each according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they make on the breastplate wreathed chains, work of thick bands, of pure gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they make two embroidered things of gold, and two rings of gold, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they put the two thick bands of gold on the two rings on the ends of the breastplate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two ends of the two thick bands they have put on the two embroidered things, and they put them on the shoulders of the ephod, over-against its front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they make two rings of gold, and set [them] on the two ends of the breastplate, on its border, which [is] on the side of the ephod within;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they make two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulders of the ephod below, over-against its front, over-against its joining, above the girdle of the ephod;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they bind the breastplate by its rings unto the rings of the ephod, with a ribbon of blue, to be above the girdle of the ephod, and the breastplate is not loosed from off the ephod, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he maketh the upper robe of the ephod, work of a weaver, completely of blue;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the opening of the upper robe [is] in its midst, as the opening of a habergeon, a border [is] to its opening round about, it is not rent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they make on the hems of the upper robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, twined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they make bells of pure gold, and put the bells in the midst of the pomegranates, on the hems of the upper robe, round about, in the midst of the pomegranates;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, [are] on the hems of the upper robe, round about, to minister in, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they make the coats of linen, work of a weaver, for Aaron and for his sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the mitre of linen, and the beautiful bonnets of linen, and the linen trousers, of twined linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the girdle of twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, work of an embroiderer, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they make the flower of the holy crown of pure gold, and write on it a writing, openings of a signet, `Holy to Jehovah;'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they put on it a ribbon of blue, to put [it] on the mitre above, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the service of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting is completed; and the sons of Israel do according to all that Jehovah hath commanded Moses; so they have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they bring in the tabernacle unto Moses, the tent, and all its vessels, its hooks, its boards, its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the covering of rams' skins, which are made red, and the covering of badgers' skins, and the vail of the covering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark of the testimony and its staves, and the mercy-seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table, all its vessels, and the bread of the presence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pure candlestick, its lamps, the lamps of arrangement, and all its vessels, and the oil for the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the spice-perfume, and the covering of the opening of the tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the brazen altar and the brazen grate which it hath, its staves, and all its vessels, the laver and its base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings of the court, its pillars, and its sockets; and the covering for the gate of the court, its cords, and its pins; and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the coloured clothes to minister in the sanctuary, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to act as priest in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that Jehovah hath commanded Moses, so have the sons of Israel done all the service;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses seeth all the work, and lo, they have done it as Jehovah hath commanded; so they have done. And Moses doth bless them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah speaketh unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `On the first day of the month, in the first month, thou dost raise up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast set there the ark of the testimony, and hast covered over the ark with the vail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast brought in the table, and set its arrangement in order, and hast brought in the candlestick, and caused its lamps to go up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast put the golden altar for perfume before the ark of the testimony, and hast put the covering of the opening to the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast put the altar of the burnt-offering before the opening of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast put the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar, and hast put water there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast set the court round about, and hast placed the covering of the gate of the court,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hast taken the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle, and all that [is] in it, and hallowed it, and all its vessels, and it hath been holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast anointed the altar of the burnt-offering, and all its vessels, and sanctified the altar, and the altar hath been most holy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast anointed the laver and its base, and sanctified it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And thou hast brought near Aaron and his sons unto the opening of the tent of meeting, and hast bathed them with water;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thou hast clothed Aaron with the holy garments, and anointed him, and sanctified him, and he hath acted as priest to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: `And his sons thou dost bring near, and hast clothed them with coats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and anointed them as thou hast anointed their father, and they have acted as priests to Me, and their anointing hath been to be to them for a priesthood age-during, to their generations.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses doth according to all that Jehovah hath commanded him; so he hath done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it cometh to pass, in the first month, in the second year, in the first of the month, the tabernacle hath been raised up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses raiseth up the tabernacle, and setteth its sockets, and placeth its boards, and placeth its bars, and raiseth its pillars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spreadeth the tent over the tabernacle, and putteth the covering of the tent upon it above, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he taketh and putteth the testimony unto the ark, and setteth the staves on the ark, and putteth the mercy-seat on the ark above;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bringeth in the ark unto the tabernacle, and placeth the vail of the covering, and covereth over the ark of the testimony, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he putteth the table in the tent of meeting, on the side of the tabernacle northward, at the outside of the vail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and setteth in order upon it the arrangement of bread, before Jehovah, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he putteth the candlestick in the tent of meeting, over-against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and causeth the lamps to go up before Jehovah, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he setteth the golden altar in the tent of meeting, before the vail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and maketh perfume on it -- spice-perfume -- as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he setteth the covering of the opening to the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of the burnt-offering he hath set at the opening of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and causeth the burnt-offering to go up upon it, and the present, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he putteth the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar, and putteth water there for washing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses and Aaron and his sons have washed their hands and their feet at the same;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in their going in unto the tent of meeting, and in their drawing near unto the altar, they wash, as Jehovah hath commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he raiseth up the court round about the tabernacle, and about the altar, and placeth the covering of the gate of the court; and Moses completeth the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cloud covereth the tent of meeting, and the honour of Jehovah hath filled the tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses hath not been able to go in unto the tent of meeting, for the cloud hath tabernacled on it, and the honour of Jehovah hath filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the going up of the cloud from off the tabernacle the sons of Israel journey in all their journeys;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if the cloud go not up then they journey not, until the day of its going up:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the cloud of Jehovah [is] on the tabernacle by day, and fire is in it by night, before the eyes of all the house of Israel in all their journeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator
